40831325.review:
Game Information

9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek, is a HOPA game, that is developed by Tap It Games and published by Artifex Mundi.

HOPA - Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure.

"The Secret of Serpent Creek" is the first installment of the "9 Clues" game series.

Game Visuals

I want to mentioned that the visuals in the game is nicely done with a painted feel to them. The visuals can be adjusted in the game's option menu.

Game Audio

I want to mentioned that the audio in the game is well done even if it is simplistic and somewhat repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the game's option menu as well.

Gameplay

There are three different difficulty game modes to choose from: Casual; Advanced and Expert.

The notebook keep tracks of progression in the game. Such as story events and clues.

There is an interactive map in the game. It allows the player to fast travel between each location quickly. It also indicates that there are certain tasks that needs to be completed at certain locations within the game. The interactive map is not automatically given at the start of the game.

There is a padlock feature that is available to lock the inventory panel in place to make it stationary.

There are some interactive items in the game. Some of the interactive items may require extra components before they can be interact with. All interactive items are marked with a symbol in one of the corners.

The hidden object scenes consists of the following: Traditional word lists. Some of these hidden object scenes may require little or no interaction.

The puzzles are fairly easy to solve without having the need to skip any of them.

There are nineteen different achievements that can be unlocked from playing the game. Each of these achievements does come with some requirements that needs to be completed before they can be unlocked.

Miscellaneous

There are six different trading cards to collect. You only get three of those trading cards from the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading card: Purchased from Steam's Community Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and its' Booster Pack Creator.

Final thoughts: I have found the game enjoyable to certain extent. The replay value for this game is low. I would recommend this game but not at the game's full price value.

39985594.review:
Je ne fais qu’une évaluation pour les deux titres, Serpent Creek (SC) et The Ward (TW), mais je recommande les deux. Dans l’ensemble, les deux titres sont très bons, dans la moyenne supérieure de ce type de jeux, je dirais. J’ai toujours le même problème avec les graphismes qui me semblent un peu datés, trop colorés, peu réalistes et les animations un peu… statiques, mais je me fais une raison, c’est le genre qui veut ça.
Le fil rouge lancé dans SC n’est pas présent dans TW, ce qui est surprenant mais nullement gênant. Le retrouvera-t-on dans le prochain ?
Pour départager les deux épisodes, je dois dire que SC m’a moins convaincu avec un scénario plus improbable, rocambolesque. Celui de TW m’a paru plus solide et convaincant.
J’ai trouvé TW plus appliqué sur le graphisme, mais ce n’était peut-être qu’une impression. Le scénario de TW recèle plus de surprises.
Au chapitre des bonnes surprises, le système d’analyse de scène de crime (le fameux « 9 clues ») est très bien fait pour TW. Je l’ai trouvé plus abouti dans TW.
Un autre point fort : la musique. Plutôt immersive dans SC, elle devient carrément un élément crucial dans TW, originale et chargée de sous-entendus propices à l’ambiance du jeu.
Je déconseille de les jouer avec la difficulté la plus basse, les jeux deviennent tellement faciles que ce ne sont plus des jeux.
Deux jeux pas très longs mais plutôt prenants, de nombreux succès dont certains nécessiteront une voire plusieurs autres parties (durée de vie augmentée) avec des scénarios travaillés, une bonne ambiance et une musique adaptée… pourquoi se priver ?

PS : pour les francophones, la traduction est excellente sauf pour un élément de la liste de chaque (!) scène d'objets cachés pour lequel cela prête à confusion.

39381615.review:
Though I would by no means ever pay 10 dollars for it, I got it in one of those G2A lootboxes and never got around to touching it. Now that my old PC is rekt and in the shop *Watchdog violation, gotta figure out where the problem lies*, I decided to give it a go. 

So right off the bat the voice acting is 'okay' but it does improve along the way. It isn't great but it's not god awful either. Essentially this game had 'okay' voice acting throughout. The story is pretty meh, and the gameplay is like any other finding hidden objects game just with a few flares. 

The puzzles are normally pretty intermediate up until a couple. There is a skip button but if you want to get all the achievements you cannot use it *of course*. 

All in all it's no magnum opus, but for me it gives me a old nostalgia feeling of when you're a little kid in a walmart in like 2009 and you see a laptop for sale and their trial game is a hidden object thing *maybe that is only me*. So for me that's a big bonus. 

All in all if you see it on sale *becaues this asking price is god awful*, and you think it's alright pick it up. I wouldn't advise paying more than like 3 dollars for it. Even that's stretching it.

38907155.review:
The bad things, which are very common in the hidden object and Point & Click adventure games:
- Somehow the main character knows beforehand which items will be needed later (and even how many of them will be needed).
- You only need one item from a HO minigame, but to get it you need to find 12 items, to then grab only the one needed item.
- You can only get the item you need from story-mandated location and time. For instance, for some obstacle you need an axe, and you can find one in a HO scene early in the game, but you don't get that as the reward. Rather, later you find another axe in different location that you can use, as that location should be unavailable until later.

But if you can look past these very common logic shortcomings, this is a good game with an interesting although quickly predictable story with many types of puzzles. The detective mode puzzles were a nice touch, although the CSI-esque recreation of the events based on found evidence is a bit unrealistic.

All in all, if you get the game in a bundle or discounted in a sale, it's a worthy item to have in your library, especially if you are into more casual games.

37793471.review:
9 Улик: Тайна Серпент-Крика – это простенькая игра по поиску предметов. В игре присутствует детективный режим и легкие головоломки. Режим детектива встретился мне впервые, но успел понравиться. Сначала нужно собрать улики, а потом уже их сопоставить для получения полной картины преступления. В игре есть карта, которая подсказывает на каких локациях нужно что-то выполнить, а на какие вернуться позже.
Вы играете за детектива-девушку, которой предстоит помочь знакомой репортерше Хелен. Она позвонила из городка Серпент-Крик и попросила о помощи, но по прибытии в город детектив не находит никаких следов Хелен. Вам нужно найти репортершу, а также узнать, что происходит в загадочном городке.
Графика и музыкальное сопровождение находятся на среднем уровне. Но, если не сильно придираться, то взять по скидке можно.
В игре есть 19 достижений, которые легко выполняются.
Оценка 6/10

36542108.review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

L'histoire est plutôt pas mal, et le récit s'enchaine très bien, ce qui n'est pas toujours le cas dans ce genre de jeu. C'est un bon point! Les doublages sont corrects, même si pas toujours présents au moment où l'on s'y attends.

Comme souvent dans ce type de jeu les traductions sont un peu pourries car probablement faites hors contexte (ex: on cherche un Fichier, mais il fallait en fait chercher une Lime... c'est File dans les deux cas en anglais). On finit par s'y habituer, ce n'est pas vraiment un mauvais point.

Ce qui plombe le jeu, c'est la trop grande simplicité. Je ne crois pas avoir passé plus de 2mins sur une SOC quelle qu'elle soit, avec la majorité terminée en moins de 30s, et les mini-jeux sont vraiment trop faciles !  

[h1]Rejouabilité, achievements[/h1]

Aucune rejouabilité ici.

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Ce n'est pas vraiment un mauvais jeu, mais je ne peux pas décemment le recommander vu sa trop grande simplicité.

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

La version Linux est excellente. Aucun soucis rencontré.

OS: Linux Mint 18.2 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i7 7700K OC@5Ghz, Nvidia 1080GTX, 32GB ram.
Screens : Triplescreen, dont un vertical, un seul screen X.

36416455.review:
Начну с того, что покупая я относилась скептически к такой игре, так как обычно такие игры идут на телефон. А значит не очень интересно (или вообще не интересно). Но не тут то было...

Плюсы "+":

1) Сюжет. Он не идеален, но для такого квеста (с "телефонным" геймплеем) довольно таки хорош. 
2) Головоломки. Они и не сложные и не очень простые. Просто обычные. Обычные головоломки.

Минусы "-":

1) Очень короткая головоломка за такую цену (конечно, это зависит от того, как быстро человек решает головоломки).

Плюс/Минус "+/-":

1) Геймплей. Однообразен. Может из-за того, что сделана и для телефонов.

2) Музыка. Так и не смогла определить либо "+" либо "-", так как музыку (практически) не замечала. Музыка и не отвратная и не идеальна, совсем чучуть придаёт (в некоторых местах) атмосферу.

3) Графика. То же что и с геймплеем. В стилистике для квест-игр на телефон (но это уже на вкус и цвет).

Итог: В целом игра неплохая, но за полную сумму не советую брать, так как она короткая и за 1 вечер пройдётся быстро. Если вам нравятся квест-игры, как на телефон, то покупате (но по скидке, так как за полную сумму она того не стоит).

Schönes Spiel.

Nette Detektivgeschichte trifft Wimmelbildspiel trifft Adventure.
Kann man in 3-4 Stunden glaube ich durchspielen.
Eines der wenigen Spiele, wo ich keine Lösung für gebraucht habe.
3 Schwierigkeitsgrade bestimmen, ob man z.B. Tipps und Wegweiserhilfen anzeigen lassen kann.
Ich habe nicht alle Steam Errungenschaften bekommen, weil ich ein Symbol übersehen hatte und dummerweise 2 Schritte später nicht mehr zurückgehen konnte. Dumm gelaufen. Auch muss man 3/3 Rätsel in unter 1 Minute schaffen. Ohne eigene Savegames viel Glück.
Leider bietet das Spiel keine FullHD-Auflösung, wie so viele Spiele nicht. Schade.
Ansonsten bin ich durchweg positiv gestimmt.

A hidden object game that tells a story and has a couple of different types of puzzels thrown in for good measure too. Is it the best story telling? No, but I enjoyed it depite the predictability. I think that my 8 year old neice would really enjoy the story though as although it isn't spooky, it isn't babyish. I might wait another year / check with her mum before allowing her to play though as you see a murder victim's body - it isn't graphic or gory but it's still a subject matter that the parents should agree on beforehand. 

I bought a few of these games when they were reduced on sale, I'm not sure I would pay full price for them (they seem to be about £6 normally) but for £2 on sale? Bargin!

34115959.review:
9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek is a very enjoyable point and click mystery. It plays well, with smooth controls although some of the interaction with tools in your inventory and the environment were odd. The story was very intriguing. I would definitely recommend this one if you enjoy a good mystery. 

The actual game mechanics of 9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek are well thought out. There is not a lot of back tracking, progressing smoothly from objective to objective. I did not experience any bugs or lag and every object I clicked responded immediately. Some of the tools were not obviously suited for the job like using two random pieces of metal to pry open a drawer.

If you like reptiles, snakes or know anything about reptilians you will enjoy the story. It's a decent mystery that pulls you in and jerks you around. The soundtrack was very good as well. Certainly setting the mode when needed.

All in all 9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek is well thought out and that does what you expect. A fun relaxing game, with a story that keeps you playing.

33969208.review:
9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek is Hidden Object Game from publisher Artifex Mundi.

A young paranormal detective requested to aid a famous riporter to lift up the secret about some suspicious event. Upon arriving to the small town of Serpent Creek you realise that the riporter gone and a curse infecting the whole city! Snakes are everywhere and the citizens are sleepwalking. Most of them are not aware of their acts. there is definetly a need for a extraordinary human to lift up the curse and save the town, this one could be you!

This HoG not just include the usual hidden object puzzles and mini games, you can experience some more entertaining crime scene puzzles aswell. Artwork is decent and voice acting ok.

Pricing is a bit too much i think, i review the games positive, because the game is good, but its shorter than usual Artifex games and more expensive. Definetly better to wait for a sale.

As your Average Achievement Hunter ill share some informations about the achievements aswell:
19 Steam achievements, easy to get them and hurray, this HoG needs only one playthrough and on any difficulty. Special focus required on some achievement though, so you dont need to replay the game. There are collectibles in the game, you need watch cutscenes, you need be fast with 3 lockpick scenes (they are easy), the usual no skip/no hint for the playthrough and you need to play with the black cat (you have 2 chances in the game).
Time to 100%: 3h

33730787.review:
A solid offering from Artifex Mundi. A few loose ends aren't tied up, but the story makes sense, the graphics are pretty, and the puzzles are sensible. A minor quibble: you can't skip past some of the animation scenes, something they fixed in the loose sequel to this game. The hidden object scenes in this are randomised, so there is some replayability.

If you play the second game in this series, you'll find that some of the mini-games are similar, and one of the extras, finding the ? marks, is also the same. More jump scares in this one, if you're of a nervous disposition. Also, snakes. I liked the music; it was both subtle, and suitable.

Pros:

+ great voice acting, except the main character (in places).
+ pretty environments.
+ good mini-games.
+ some replayability.
+ map with notations.
+ logical adventure sequences.
+ extra gameplay (finding the ? marks).
+ appropriate, unobtrusive music.
+ Mr Breebo!
+ achievements.
+ trading cards.

Cons:

- some unresolved threads.
- like, really unresolved.
- the main character's voice.
- can't skip some of the animations.

Ephy Rating: 7/10

Summary: 9 Clues is certainly worth picking up on sale. The gameplay is solid, the mini-games are sensible, the voice-acting is largely competent, and the graphics are pretty. The unresolved plot threads annoyed me (what is up with the zombie-like people in town?), but that was the most irritating thing. Not as good as their second game, so if you're given a choice, get 9 Clues 2. Unless you really like snakes.

Snakes. Why did it have to be snakes?

33553412.review:
This was a decent HOG, probably not a top 10 favorite, but I say buy it if you enjoy these types of games as a quick escape.

The storyline was good/fine, and a bit new to me compared to a few other games I've played, and that is what made it enjoyable. I also didn't feel like it was a cliché, at least not entirely, unlike Enigmatis 1. Also, the voice acting was bleh for the most part (like most HOG's games I've encountered). The main character's voice is probably the worst, it sounds....breathless? I'm not quite sure how to explain it. A few character's weren't too bad though.

Gameplay wise, the hidden object scenes were nothing amazing (at least on normal mode), and some scenes repeat at least 2-3 times. Normally it takes me a good few minutes to find everything with the newer games, but with this game I could breeze through those scenes easily, which means experts and hardcore player's will probably find this game far too easy. Unlockable hidden objects are also easy to do and don't take much work (about 1 to 2 per scene). The puzzles were easy as well and don't take long. Basically, the game is short, so if you want a long game this might not be for you. There is also a map for teleportation, and there is quite a bit of backtracking.

The achievements are easy to get, and even if you mess up during your first play-through, a quick run through a second game will easily complete them. I missed some of the clues during my first run but gathered the ones I could still obtain, and during my second run I only needed to gather the missing ones and I got the achievement.

Overall, good game and recommend you get it for your collection when it is on sale.

33495163.review:
You really can't go wrong with this game! I play a LOT of HOG's, I must say this one was a great addition to my collection. It had an interesting storyline, which I am sure was supposed to be scary, however I found it quite amusing and just couldn't wait until my suspicions were proven to be true. The game was fairly short, and very easy for a HOG, but I actually found this to be refreshing. I think this would even be a great game to start someone off with who is new to HOG's. Achievements were also very easy to get 100% in, so no second playthroughs needed, like many other Artifex Mundi games. 

Pros:
* Short and sweet
* Easy Puzzles
* Interesting Plot ( If a bit silly, lol )
* Detective Mode ( A new mode of searching for objects that is only in the 9 Clues games )
* Easy Achievements
* Sets up story for the 2nd game in series

Cons:
* Voice-acting was a little hokey ( I actually liked it, but I'm a little hokey myself, lol )
* Game may be too short for some ( read, buy it on sale if that bothers you )
* May also be too easy for Die-Hard HO gamers  ( it's ok just to relax sometimes, lol )
* Limited Re-playability ( Meaning: you don't HAVE to replay it; only if you want to )

To be honest, it's hard for me to come up with any real cons for this game. So, basically, if you like HOG's, then you should own this game, and the next in the series, 9 Clues 2: The Ward. For those of you who think this one is too easy, the second game in the series is a little more difficult, so that should give you reason to start your journey with this series today.

If you like hidden-object/puzzle games, this game surely is a more lightweight entry in the genre. It's fairly short and I'm not sure if the full price is really justified, but it's very approachable, looks nice and works fine even on my Linux system.

The story has some weird pacing and logics at times (oh no, your friend is in immediate peril in the lighthouse, let's break into the library, cemetery and the mayor's mansion first before we return to the lighthouse and get her out) and is in general not overly complex, but at least the writing is decent overall.

So, no unambiguous recommendation, but if you like this kind of game, it's probably no waste of money

포인트&클릭 장르의 명가 '아티펙스 문디' 가 배급한 게임 중 하나인 [b]《9가지 단서: 서펜트 크리크의 비밀》[/b]입니다. 사실 저는 '아티펙스 문디' 의 제품들을 사놓기만 하고, 정작 플레이하는 것은 이번이 처음입니다. 정말 괜찮더군요. 어떻게 이런 게임'만' 만드는 지 이해가 됐습니다.

 + 스토리에 충분히 녹아들 게 만드는 갓-한글화
 + 어려울 때는 거침 없이 힌트를 사용하자(퍼즐을 제외하고는 도전과제에 영향을 안 받는다)

32410765.review:
Обычно детективами становятся восторженные блондинки с экстрасенсорными способностями. Не верите? Тогда вам определенно стоит поиграть в эту игру. 

What on earth happened here?!

В пгт Змеиный Ручей приезжает некая «Дана Скалли», которая тупит со страшной силой на каждом шагу и даже не понятно, как такую блонду взяли в детективы, судя по всему, частные. Однако у нее есть один важный талант. Даже два. Первый – совать нос туда, куда не следует. Мадам не брезгует кражами со взломом и с легкостью ФСОшника роется в чужих вещах. Второй – ясновиденье. Несколько улик, разбросанных по комнате, и вот уже наша Джуна Малдер складывает четкую картину, что здесь недавно произошло, даже если по факту это полный бред опившегося черной мамбой серпенткрикчанина. 

Сложных загадок не будет. Не завезли. Максимум, что потревожит ваши мыслительные рецепторы -это мини-головоломки со взломом замков. Целых три за всю игру. Все остальное – неприлично просто. Поэтому выбить все ачивки в игре сможет даже пятикласник после «Охота Крепкое». 

И все же. На самом деле мне нравится, как Artifex Mundi делает казуальные квесты-головоломки. Простоватенько, но со вкусом. Со сценариями на уровне школьной постановки, но зато без тени занудства. Это игры буквально на пару вечеров, а то и пару часов, но не раздражающие практически ничем. 

Жаль только, что в детективной истории почти нет детектива, а саспенс слишком игрушечный. С самого начала мы понимаем, что всех убил… образно говоря, «дворник» ;) И даже причастность «кастелянши» и «вахтера» считывается неприлично сразу. Пугать игра честно пытается, но это ей совершенно не удается. Ибо градус мультяшности несколько превышен :) 

Пожалуй, это не самый лучший представитель жанра, но, поверьте, совсем неплохой. Попадется на убер-распродаже, берите. Карточками отобьете ;)

C'est un jeu d'Objets Cachés assez moyen dans sa réalisation. 

Les Scènes d'Objets Cachés sont moins fréquentes que d'habitude mais beaucoup trop faciles car le nombre d'objets présents est très limité. Les enigmes ne sont pas non plus très compliquées. A noter quelques belles "coquilles" de traduction : cassette = ruban adhésif, fichier = coupe papier... 

L'histoire qui sert de support n'est pas inintéressante (clin d'oeil à Lovecraft en passant) mais la mise en scène manque cruellement d'un "je ne sais quoi".

Pas le jeu d'Objets Cachés du siècle donc, mais il fait son travail de jeu "casual" sans prise de tête. Comptez dans les 3 heures en mode Expert. A prendre à petit prix, en promotion.

31506200.review:
Игра из серии "Поиск предметов". Притом раньше играл с более хорошей прорисовкой и было круто рассматривать и выискивать маленькие предметы, расчищая поле. Тут же анимировано всё довольно криво. Причём даже в главном меню много лишнего - реклама других проектов компании и прочей мишуры.

Что понравилось:

+ Поддержка стимовских фишек - линукс, облако, карточки, достижения.

Что не понравилось:
- Маленькая продолжительность и предсказуемость сюжета
- Анимация не дотягивает до уровня "Обалденно" и находится на среднем уровне
- Мелодии довольно скучны и навевают тоску
- Сюжет очень слабый и порой отдаёт бредом.

Есть представители жанра поиска и получше с более крутым оформлением. А тут разрабы просто клепают игры и уже просто закидали однообразными поделками на час игры.

It seems to be a lot easier than other Artifex Mundi games, I figured things out almost immediately without having to think too much. This could be a good thing because it makes it a better "relax" game to really turn your mind off, but when I play hidden object games, I like that mental stimulation and the challenge of the puzzle. It's a very quick short game, quicker than other Artifex Mundi games, but its still something to expect out of these games. The cut scenes were overly dramatic and all the voice acting was horrendous even in Artifex Mundi's standards (in most Artifex Mundi games, there's at least ONE decent voice actor/actress, but this game made me want to play the game on mute, save for the nice music). The story is also a little farfetched even for Artifex Mundi. But I don't play these games for the story, just the puzzles. So despite the laughable parts of the game, it was still fun.

30415162.review:
Your partner goes missing and it's up to you, a detective, to discover what happened in Serpent Creek.
[b]9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek[/b] is a Hidden Object game that uses hand drawings to present us with a very well written storyline, although extremely predicted from the very start. Cliché aside, it's still a fantastic mystery adventure in a small town filled with secrets!

With a great atmosphere for casual horror enthusiasts, [b]9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek[/b] is barely a secret as soon as you meet the first NPC's. Don't get fooled though, you might have what it takes to be a detective, just follow your guts.
This average in length title will still make you more than excited to find out what's really behind Serpent Creek. Is it the suspicious mayor? The overcautious hotel manager? Or perhaps the veteran Sheriff officer? Doesn't matter how soon you figure it out, the 50's thrill will get you hyped enough to keep pursuing the end.

Personally, I enjoyed the puzzles, they weren't extremely hard, but still represent a challenge, especially if your a casual puzzler.
The Hidden Object's scenarios are all nice and not confusing at all, even with a very special design, they are still easy to spot, and for me that's a fantastic thing to have in mind.
[b]9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek[/b] also presents the player with a very special [i]Clue[/i] system, where you have to find the clues in a specific crime scene, after they're all displayed, the events of the crime are revealed to the player thanks to our character detective skills.

9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek is a fantastic Hidden Object game that I highly recommend to anyone who is either in the genre, or just looking for a great adventure.
6/10

Disclaimer:  I love playing hidden object puzzles.  I love finding the hidden items, solving all the games, and discovering all of the little extras.  

With that in mind, I must say that "9 Clues:  The Secret of Serpent Creek" is a little easy.  I never had trouble finding all of the hidden items.  Even the items that take an extra step to find (such as getting a handle to open a drawer) are exceedingly easy to find.  The hardest part of the game was solving the lockpick puzzles in under a minute to get the achievement.

The only other complaint I have is that I could not skip through some repetitive dialogue.  The first playthrough I listen to everything, but on the second playthrough I want to skip the parts I already know.  The game allows you to skip some conversations, but not everything.

Otherwise, this is a nice way to pass the time, so long as you understand it won't take too long to finish.

A história do jogo é simples e previsível, mas diverte aqueles que buscam um passatempo despretensioso. Os gráficos são bonitos e os quebra-cabeças são fáceis, no geral. 29256706.review:
[i]Outre les objets, le fun est caché aussi[/i]

[b]9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek[/b], sorti en 2013, est un Hidden Object (Objets cachés) où l'on incarne une détective partant à la rescousse de son amie, Hélène Hunter, dans la ville de Serpent Creek. S'en suit moult péripéties et "révélations".

[i]Tout d'abord, je tiens à dire que c'est mon tout premier Hidden Object. Je n'ai aucune expérience dedans, aucun élément à comparer, référence, etc... C'est nouveau pour moi (et ça commence mal...)[/i]

[h1]Les plus :[/h1]

- [Trouvez le point positif parmis tous ces points]

[h1]Les moins :[/h1]

- Le gameplay est très simple. Plan fixe, déplacement par zone, on explore avec la souris, comme un Point&Click, donc je suis pas paumé. Faut trouver des éléments sur ces différents plans fixes : indices, personnages, etc...Cependant, les phases de recherche sont terriblements simples, ennuyantes, car aucun challenge, même au dernier niveau de difficulté. La relation, parfois, entre certains groupes d'objets à trier et l'objet à trouver au final est.. aberrante. (Je n'ai plus l'exemple en tête mais c'est comme si tu cherchais dans un tas de viande pour en ressortir avec une carotte)
- Graphiquement pas ouf, j'ai vu mieux. De plus, certains passages dans le jeu font brouillons (et les personnages sont particulièrement laids)
- Et bien sûr... l'HISTOIRE ! Je suis pas spécialiste, mais entre ça et les énigmes, c'est le genre de choses à ne pas rater dans ce type de jeu. Bah là, oui, ils l'ont fait. Un méchant repéré à 10km, ils l'ont fait. Des dialogues bancals et indignes d'intérêt, ils l'ont fait. Bref, je me suis fait ch*é, avec seulement environ 3h de contenu !
- Une traduction française qui laisse à désirer.

[h1]N.B. :[/h1]

- Evaluation de [i]9 Clues 2: The Ward[/i] --> [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/Kazadrur/recommended/369420/]Voir ici[/url]

[h1]Conclusion :[/h1]

Donc bon, comme première expérience, j'ai eu mieux.. (Quoique.. :) )
Je ne le recommande pas car rien n'est bon dans ce jeu. Pas l'histoire, ni les énigmes, ni les graphismes, ni les dialogues, ni la bande-son. Juste un jeu à cartes et succès à 100%

_ _ _ _

[h1]Si vous avez trouvé cette évaluation utile, et que vous voulez en discuter autour d'un verre, venez rejoindre notre [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/AlternaTyff#curation]page de curation et nos forums ![/url][/h1]

28235093.review:
9 Clues jest przykładem produkcji, którą faktycznie można już potraktować jako przygodówkę, a nie wrzucać do jednego wora ze zwykłymi hidden object games, bo nic innego nie pasuje.

Helen Hunter, dziennikarka, udała się do miasteczka Serpent Creek, by zrobić reportaż o miejscowym festynie. Na miejscu wpadła na trop pewnej afery, w związku z czym poprosiła swoją przyjaciółkę o pomoc. Gracz wciela się we wspomnianą przyjaciółkę, prywatną detektyw specjalizującą się w sprawach paranormalnych. Gdy przybywa na miejsce, okazuje się, że Helen zaginęła, a w miasteczku dzieją się dziwne rzeczy.

No kto by się spodziewał, dziwne rzeczy w miejscowości o nazwie Serpent Creek? Tak, jestem trochę złośliwy, gdyż z jednej strony gra chce nawiązywać klimatem do X-Files, Cthulhu, czy może nawet pierwszego Gabriel Knighta, a z drugiej robi to tak mało subtelnie, że aż ciężko to opisać. Szkoda, bo lokacje, zagadki, sekwencje hidden object (w których liczba przedmiotów jest sensownie dobrana, zaś całość czytelna i nie męczy wzroku) są prześlicznie namalowane. Muzyka zgrabnie podkreśla intencje grafików, ale całość niweczą projekty i zachowanie postaci, czy wszechobecne węże (kolejna niespodzianka…). Główny zły byłby bardziej oczywisty chyba tylko, gdyby mu to napisać na czole.

Trzon rozgrywki stanowią: eksploracja, korzystanie z przedmiotów w odpowiednich miejscach, strzępy rozmów, liczne łamigłówki oraz „poziomy” hidden object (w dwóch wariantach). Dostępne są 3 poziomy trudności, które różnią się liczbą wyświetlanych podpowiedzi. Dla weteranów przygodówek nawet najwyższy nie będzie stanowił wyzwania, choć można go sobie trochę zwiększyć niejako poza ustawieniami gry, jeśli uprzemy się zdobyć wszystkie osiągnięcia za pierwszym podejściem, a kilka z nich potrafi zagrać na ambicji.

Dla osób zaczynających znajomość z grami przygodowymi 9 Clues stanowi dobry wstęp. Z kolei zaprawieni w bojach mogą potraktować tę grę, jako relaksator przed cięższym tytułem. Moja ocena w skali szkolnej: 4.

http://kresowyblog.blogspot.com/2015/08/9-clues-secret-of-serpent-creek.html

28004352.review:
I secretly love the Hidden Object Game genre (or HOGs, as I love to call them). This is one of those games, and it's published by the best in the niche biz, Artifex Mundi. It's as polished as the genre gets, although maybe just a little bit too easy compared to some of the other AM games I've played. I'm not complaining in the slightest because it was a quick, relaxing, and enjoyable diversion in the midst of a lot of mediocrity.

As for why I enjoy the genre so much, I think it has a lot to do with their tendency toward horror themes and the super casual spaced out gameplay. You solve some puzzles, you find some objects, there's no penalty for fucking up unless you want there to be. As for the horror themes, the writing in these games is invariably almost completely nonsensical in a strangely comfortable and familiar way. I can't exactly put it into words, but to try to give you an idea, this game is about a town hypnotized by a snake-man mayor who wants to resurrect a shape shifting snake god and rule the world. Also the snake man mayor has a one armed cop sidekick. Why does the cop only have one arm? BECAUSE HE DOES, ASSHOLE.

Anyway, not my favorite HOG, and I wouldn't imagine that it would change anyone's mind on the genre if they weren't already into it, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone I know, but fuck you it was a pretty enjoyable couple hours.

9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek jest jedną z gier Polskiego studia Artfiex Mundi. Podobnie jak i do pozostałych gier z kuźni AM i ta pozwala po cięzkim dniu "niedzielnym" graczom odprężyć się i wcielić się na chwilę w detektyw, zajmującą się wyjaśnianiem zjawisk paranormalnych. Obytym z serią Artifex Mundi, gra przedstawi kolejną niezwykłą historię, pod wieloma względami wyróżniająca się na tle pozostałej twórczości studia. Historia w tym wypadku, posiada wiele zwrotów akcji, jest "doroślejsza" i swobodnie dotyka tematu śmierci i intrygi knutej przez mieszkańców malowniczego miasteczka.

Plusy:
- prosty zestaw osiagnięć umożliwiajacy w krótkim czasie dodanie kolejnej gry do kolekcji 100%

- niektóre z zagadek wymagaja dużej precyzji w użyciu ekwipunku przez co czasami nie za pierwszym razem czynność jest możliwa do wykonania

26406903.review:
So this is my second review on Steam, and it's about a girl. Well, rather, it's about a girl in a creepy town trying to rescue her friend from a horrible secret the town hides. And that's exactly what the premise of this game is.

Like I stated in my previous review, I have been playing HOA games since the very first game of its kind surfaced and was among the first to discover just how fun they were. It's not just about finding objects in scenes anymore; it's about adventure and story! And, although most may find this story concept a tad cliche, it is a solid storyline with a mysterious ending and one hell of a twist.

The "9 Clues" series is unique to the genre in the fact that it presents a new method of finding things: investigation scenes where you need to find, you guessed it, nine clues in all as to what happened during the scene of struggle and/or vandalism. Once you find all nine, the scene plays itself out as if what really happened was happening right in front of you. Then you make your conclusion and progress. It's a rather interesting method that I found to be contributive to the story as well as really making you look for signs of vandalism or general disturbance. It was a fun process and I managed to get them all luckily. Depending on your level of difficulty, the scene can be easy or hard. Really it's up to personal preference as to how you choose to play.

The hidden object scenes were fairly easy for me to solve as well as some of the puzzles, but the graphics and the storyline more than make up for the level of difficulty in my personal opinion. Everything looks like it's straight out of an oil painting, the characters are memorable throughout the duration of the game, and sometimes it just gets downright dark and disturbing. People get killed, bodies get discovered, conspiricies within the town are uncovered, and overall it's not something I'd suggest young children or the easily disturbed play. But the story itself is good, if a little out of the ballpark, and the gameplay was fun and relaxing. I played for the story; you might play for something else.

Overall, a fun game with a good story; can't wait to start playing 9 Clues 2!

缺点：流程偏短，没有附送小故事，差评。

6.5/10.0

25840541.review:
9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek ist ein Hidden Objekt Spiel von Tap it Games. Unsere Heldin, eine Detektivin, wird von ihrer Freundin Helen in eine kleine Stadt gerufen in der merkwürdige Dinge vor sich gehen. Diese kann man auch selbst beobachten, kaum das man vor seinem Hotel angekommen ist. Alle Menschen benehmen sich entweder sehr verdächtig oder merkwürdig und zu allem Überfluss ist Helen auch noch verschwunden. So beginnt die Suche nach der Freundin und einer Antwort auf die Frage, was in dieser Stadt falsch läuft. Eigentlich eine ganz nette Detektiv Geschichte, allerdings ist zu leicht erkennbar wer die Bösewichte sind. Zudem fand ich die meisten Personen sehr unsympatisch und/oder nervig. Das gilt insbesondere auch für die Protagonistin, die sich mehr als einmal weigert Behälter zu öffnen oder Treppen hoch zu steigen, nur weil diese z.B. mit Öl verschmiert sind und das obwohl das Leben ihrer Freundin oder sogar ihr eigenes davon abhängt.
Das Gameplay ist sehr Genretypisch, man bewegt die Heldin von Hintergrund zu Hintergrund, hält nach Objekten ausschau mit denen man etwas anfangen kann, sucht sich durch Wimmelbilder und löst hin und wieder ein Rätsel. Zudem gibt es noch die "Detektivfolgen" was auch eine Art Wimmelbild ist. Allerdings sind dabei nicht Gegenstände vorgegeben die man finden soll, sondern man muss alles anklicken was "verdächtig" aussieht. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist dabei recht niedrig, fast alle Rätsel sind sehr leicht und schnell zu lösen. Für die etwas fauleren Spieler gibt es natürlich auch eine Hinweis Option und die Möglichkeit Rätsel zu überspringen. Abseits davon gibt es noch eine kleine Nebenaufgabe, die darin besteht Fragezeichen (?) zu finden, was auch recht anspruchsvoll ist bzw. ein gutes Auge erfordert.
Grafisch ist das Spiel ganz ok. Die meisten Figuren sehen recht gut aus und die Hintergründe und vor allem die Wimmelbilder sind sehr detailreich. Hinzu kommen die Filme die auch in Ordnung sind.
Der Ton ist den Entwicklern ziemlich gut gelungen. Die Charaktere sind gut vertont und die Musik passt sehr gut zu den jeweiligen Situationen. Vor allem die etwas "gruseligeren" Szenen werden vom Sound sehr gut untermalt und sorgen sogar in einem solchen Spiel für einen Hauch von Horror.
Insgesamt ein solides Hidden Objekt Spiel. Genrefans können ruhig mal einen Blick drauf werfen und durch den geringen Schwierigkeitsgrad ist es auch für Einsteiger durchaus geeignet. Wartet aber unbedingt auf einen 50% oder mehr Sale denn die aktuellen 10 Euro ist es meiner Meinung nach bei nur 2-4 Stunden Spielzeit nicht Wert.

挺久之前玩过一遍，刚刚照着攻略把全成就做了。

这种点点点的寻物解谜游戏，内容其实都大同小异。主角总是上知天文下知地理，开得锁接得线，但就是有丢三落四的习惯，锤子、斧子、刀这种无论去哪里都很有用的工具总是用完就随手扔，到后面还得找别的办法。剧情也都傻傻的，反派总是不负责任的把主角丢到能够逃脱的位置，他们虽然胸怀毁灭世界的大计，但归根结底觉悟还是不够啊。

然而于我，对这类游戏意外的完全没有抵抗力。

反正套路都很熟悉了，画面够精美，小游戏够有趣，还可以期待一下制作组开的脑洞，特别是可以寻物....没错，寻物，我爱寻物，真是何乐而不为呢。

好评：
· 画面精美，音效好
· 有中文，翻译水平还不错
· 线索侦查模式能让你体验当柯南的感觉
· 本作谜题非常简单，全成就容易

[h1]- Review below ----------------------------------------------------------------------[/h1]

9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek is one of the less stunning (graphics) of Artifex Mundi. Despite that and some other things the game is still quite good.

The scene takes place in Serpent Creek where your friend Helen Hunter asked your help immediately. As a female paranormal private investigator you’ll need to find trace of Ms. Hunter who has gone missing. Also you’ll soon discover why this city was called Serpent Creek and discover even more things about that city: its citizens, the old city discoveries, the tremors and some Aztec (or another tribe?) belongings in the museum. The story itself is set in two genres: action (where you need to fight for your survival) and investigation. (where you need to gather every clues you may have in order to understand what’s going on in that city) Also the game has some cut scenes which a 50’s- style noir.

As every Artifex Mundi game you can move freely in different area (of Serpent Creek) and need to solve some puzzles and find all objects in hidden objects scenes. The game has 3 difficulties and a guest feature: every one of the family can play an independent save and resume the game where they left it. When you first play the game you’ll have a notebook where you have all your objectives as well as all your notes. Adding to that you’ll have a hint button that will help you in many ways but be warned that you may not use it in any puzzle or hidden object scene (HOS)or investigation scene (IS). Hints can be used to know where you need to go, where is the next interaction or to show an object or clue in an HOS or IS or to skip a puzzle.

One of the very good thing of this game is that there are 2 (almost) unique features you won’t find in any other Artifex Mundi game:
-	You’ll have several Investigation scenes which come independently from the hidden object scenes.
-	You’ll need to lock pick (3 times) with different tools.

To talk about the investigation scene: you see the current scene where there are many clues more or less obvious. You need to find every of them without the name/type of each clue. (If you play on an easier mode your cursor will glow when you are close to a clue) When you found every clue, you’ll imagine how the scene happened.

Finally the game has collectibles to find : 9 question marks hidden in several area of the game that will give you several achievements.

(*) : 
In addition to no skip or use any hint while playing every puzzles and Hidden objects scenes, there are more missable achievements. Some are obvious but can still be missed : read 3 newspapers, play with Breebo (interact with the cat several time) and watch a cut scene triggered by a set of painting in the museum. They can be missed because more you go further in the story and more area are closed. That is also true for finding the 9 clues (9 question marks) which a few of them will be accessible for a limited time. The last but not least requires you to finish 3 lock pick puzzles (all) in less than one minute. Well that’s not that hard but only the second one is a little more challenging I must say.

Finally if you missed anything while finishing your first playthrough, you’ll need to play the game again with the same profile. (achievements are linked to the profile: you can track your achievement in-game) The good thing is you only need to succeed where you failed : meaning that if you failed to find 1 clue among the 9 or failed 1 lock pick game among the 3 : you just need to succeed the only one which is missing.

23878218.review:
[i]9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek[/i] is a well-designed hidden object puzzle game by Tap It Games and top genre publisher Artifex Mundi. The graphics are more cartoonish, but they still fit the film noir / 1950s detective theme. I like how the sound effects are tailored to the theme as well – in this case, an old-fashioned camera sound occurs when you click on things. The 9 clues mechanic which gives the game its name is fun even if the stories deduced are a little funny in an out there sort of way.

The game is susceptible to those idiosyncrasies that sometimes occur in this type of game. For example, requiring you to open a pull-tab can with a knife. Also, as a museum professional – ack! Lol the treatment of artifacts. I also had a minor quibble with historical accuracy. Elvis Presley first started making music in 1953, so he certainly wasn't famous enough to be known as the King by the time this game takes place in September of that year.

However, the ending leaves room for a sequel, and I purchased the sequel as soon as possible when it came out, so let that speak for itself. :)

23092631.review:
A solid example of the HOG genre. Generic puzzles and HO scenes, with above average voice acting, and a typical HOG mystery story to follow. The strongest thing this game had to offer were the ambient sounds and soundtrack, which fit well with the subject matter and probably went unnoticed, which is the sign of a good soundscape. 

The only issues were that the HO scenes were far too easy, and few, if any, of the puzzles were challenging and the graphics ranged from very detailed in some scenes, to very simple and basic in others with almost no interactivity.

Overall, it's a good introduction to the genre, as you would expect from Artifex Mundi, but experienced HOG players will probably feel unchallenged even if they enjoyed playing through the story.

23084631.review:
[h1]9개의 단서 : 서펀트 크리크의 비밀[/h1]

Hidden Object게임으로 Artifex Mundi사가 퍼블리셔만 맡은 게임이다.
게임의 일러스트만 봐도 아티펙스 먼디가 직접 제작한 게임은 아니라는걸 알수 있다.
물론, 아티펙스 먼디사에서 직접 제작한 게임들보다는 퀄리티면에서 다소 떨어지는 감은 있다.

본인은 이 게임을 2014년도에 모바일로 먼저 플레이했다가 최근에서야 PC판으로 다시 하게 되었는데...
본 게임의 플레이타임은 2~3시간 정도로 짧은 편이지만 이런 종류의 게임으로서는 스토리가 나름 괜찮았고
다시 플레이했는데도 상당히 재밌게 했던거같다.

이 게임은 본편 스토리외에는 서브 서토리가 없어서 다소 비약한 편이긴하지만,
대신에 스토리가 괜찮고 게임성이 좋아서 구입하면 후회는 안할 게임이라고 생각한다.

도전과제용 게임으로도 좋은데, 미리 예습(?)을 하고 게임에 임한다면 1회차 플레이가 가능하다.
도전과제 중에 모르고 그냥 지나쳐서 2회차때 하게 되는 도전과제나 1분 안에 자물쇠를 따는 도전과제가 있는데,
이건 처음하게 되면 생각보다 잘 안풀려서 도전과제 달성이 생각보다 어렵다는걸 느낄 것이다.

자물쇠 따기는 일정 률이 있으므로 하다보면 터득하게 되겠지만 정 1분안에 못하겠다면
가이드를 참조하서 푸는 것도 좋을 것이다.
본인은 총2회차를 해서 도전과제를 모두 완료시켰다.

이 시리즈도 현재 2편까지 나와있는데,
Tap It Games라는 다소 인지도가 낮은 회사에서 만든 게임으로서는 상당히 잘 만든 게임이고,
앞으로도 좋은 게임을 많이 제작해줬으면 하는 바램이다.


평점 80점의 Hidden Object게임

22991680.review:
9 Улик: Тайна Серпент-Крика - весьма годный "поиск скрытых предметов", от польских камрадов.

1) Сюжет: повествование идет о приключениях женщины детектива, чья подруга журналист, внезапно пропала в небольшом городке Серпент-Крик, перед своим исчезновением успев позвонить нашей героине. Действие происходит в США в 50-х годах прошлого века. Наш детектив прибывает в городок, жители которого питают странный фетиш к змеям, в результате своих поисков наша героиня узнает о старинных преданиях о змеином божестве, странные истории о змеелюдях, а также главный секрет местного мэра. История в духе этакого легкого мистического триллера прописана замечательно. Ну а концовка традиционно намекает на продолжение.

2) Геймплей: большую часть игры занимает поиск нужных предметов в горах барахла, что понятно учитывая жанр. Локации с поиском не сильно захламлены, и поиск достаточно легкий. Кроме того есть n-е количестов паззлов, а также несколько мини-игр: режим детектива - тот же поиск объектов, только названий не дано, а курсор начинает светиться если приблизились к нужно предмету, в этом режим реконструируются события произошедшие в локации; взлом замков - нужно поворачивать замок двумя ручками - одна движется на определенное число шагов вправо, другая так же влево, нужно подсветить все блоки. В игре есть 3 режима сложности, но она легка, даже на сложном, но для тех кому все же сложно (или лень) есть возможность использовать подсказку, и пропускать паззлы. Плюс есть легкие достижения - сложность может доставить толька одно - поиск улик, для этого надо найти скрытые на локациях знаки вопроса. Сложность в том, что в некоторые локации вернуться будет нельзя, так что если что-то пропустили надо переигрывать. Игра легко проходится часа за 2-3. За это же время выпадут карточки, кому они нужны.

3) Графика и звуки: в игре очень качественная картинка, есть неплохие кат-сцены. Также присутствует хорошая английская озвучка, и не очень точные русские субтитры.

Как итог: весьма достойный представитель жанра, тем кому нравятся мистические детективы, к покупке рекомендую!
8 улик из 10.

22960245.review:
As far as HOPA games go, 9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek is fairly formulaic and the puzzles were astoundingly easy (i'm not a big puzzle person, and this is probably the first HOPA were i haven't had to use the Skip button on at least one of the puzzles). The HO scenes, likewise, were astoundingly easy (i got through many of them in under a minute, and most of the rest in under 90 seconds). i found the "find the clues" scenes to be a bit odd - you're simply moving the mouse around the screen to uncover the hot zones (which cause the mouse to flash) to help the protagonist construct a "what happened here" script, which invariably turns out to contain a good deal of outrageous conjecture. i could have done without those parts.

Nonethess - nice graphics, good voice-overs, and no major negatives. i can recommend this to the truly casual gamers, but those who are looking for challenging puzzle/HO scenes will be disappointed by its lack of challenge. For casual players, though, it's a well-made romp.

22902772.review:
9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek to polskiej produkcji gra przygodowa, osadzona w latach pięćdziesiątych dwudziestego wieku, w Ameryce. Jej główną bohaterką jest prywatna detektyw, specjalizująca się w wyjaśnianiu zjawisk paranormalnych. Kobieta otrzymuje telefon, z którego dowiaduje się o strasznych odkryciach dokonanych w miasteczku Serpent Creek przez jej znajomą reporterkę, Helen Hunter. Po dotarcie na miejsce bohaterka odkrywa, że jej przyjaciółka zniknęła z niewyjaśnionych okolicznościach. Co więcej, po ulicach miasteczka pełzają węże, a jego mieszkańcy zachowują się, jakby byli pod hipnozą.

Omawiany tytuł reprezentuje gatunek Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure, jest więc nieskomplikowaną przygodówką, zapewniającą krótką, prostą i przyjemną rozgrywkę. Jako że jest to produkcja skierowana głównie dla graczy casualowych, nie brakuje w niej licznych podpowiedzi i ułatwień rozgrywki, z których można skorzystać w dowolnym momencie.

Gier typu HOPA w swojej karierze gracza przeszedłem wiele i fabularnie wypadały one bardzo różnie. 9 Clues pod tym względem zalicza się na szczęście do lepszej części z nich. Przedstawiona tu zagadkowa, kryminalna historia jest dobrze opowiedziana i potrafi zaangażować gracza. Odkrywanie kolejnych mrocznych sekretów Serpent Creek po prostu ciekawi, a co najważniejsze, opowieść trzyma poziom do samego końca. Nie można też nie wspomnieć o ręcznie malowanych lokacjach, doskonale budujących klimat grozy i niepokoju. Choć da się zauważyć, że nie były one tworzone z myślą o rozdzielczości fullHD. Wrażenie psuje też trochę nienajlepsze spolszczenie gry. Odpowiedzialni za nie ludzie najwyraźniej nie mają pojęcia, w jakich okolicznościach powinno używać się apostrofów. Ze stawianiem przecinków też sobie nie radzą. To razi w oczy, szczególnie że mówimy przecież o polskiej produkcji. Poza tym gra mogłaby być trochę krótsza. Jej ukończenie zajęło mi zaledwie dwie godziny z hakiem, na pierwszym z trzech poziomów trudności.

Pod względem rozgrywki 9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek to raczej typowa HOPA i jak na grę z tego gatunku przystało, mamy do czynienia z pierwszoosobową, klikaną przygodówką, kładącą nacisk na eksplorację lokacji, odnajdywanie w nich przedmiotów i ich odpowiednie ich wykorzystywanie. I pod tym względem gra wypada dobrze. Poza tym występuje w niej sporo łamigłówek logicznych i sekwencje hidden object, polegających na odnajdywaniu na zagraconym ekranie wskazanych przedmioty. Jedne i drugie nie należą do szczególnie trudnych i weteranów gatunku niczym nie zaskoczą, aczkolwiek rozwiązuje się je dość przyjemnie. Swoistą innowacją jest tzw. tryb detektywistyczny. W sumie to takie specjalne sekwencje hidden object. Gracz musi w nich wskazać na miejscu zbrodni poszlaki, na podstawie których później zostanie przeprowadzona wizualizacja zajścia. Całkiem miłe urozmaicenie.

Podsumowując, 9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek to jedna z ciekawszych przygodówek typu HOPA, z jakimi się spotkałem. Głównie z powodu wciągającej fabuły oraz klimatycznej oprawy wizualnej. Pod względem rozgrywki wypada ona bardzo standardowo w porównaniu do innych gier tego typu, aczkolwiek jest tu dodatkowy, drobny smaczek w postaci trybu detektywistycznego. Całkiem dobra pozycja dla fanów przygodówek.

22879776.review: Playing through Serpent Creek was a lot of fun! I enjoyed the creepy atmosphere and ridiculous plot-twists quite a bit. The voice acting is pretty good too, though some of the characters do sound a bit flat. (Luckily there are skip buttons available for cutscenes so you can just read the subtitles and move on if you so desire) My only complaint--and it's more of a critcism--is that none of the hidden object scenes were anywhere near as challenging as they are in other Artifex Mundi games. (I'm thinking of Enigmatis specifically since it shares a lot of similar themes with Serpent Creek) While this can be good news if you're looking for something casual to relax with, if you want more of a challenge, you might have better luck finding it elsewhere. Overall, I definitely recommend Serpent creek, especially if you are fond of plots involving supernatural mysteries!

22636548.review:
Juego simpatico, facil y entrenido, muy en la linea de lo que suele ofrecer el genero de Objetos Ocultos en general y la desarolladora Artifex Mundi en particular. 

La formula es la habitual, una historia misteriosa y sobrenatural con algun que otro asesinato por medio y que recuerda a las peliculas de serie B, puzzles muy sencillos y escenas de objetos ocultos mas sencillas aun. 

El juego no es de los mejores de Artifex Mundi que he jugado, este juego tiene ya unos añitos y la desarolladora a mejorado mucho sus juegos, y quizas sea uno de los mas faciles pero esta bastante bien, entretiene las pocas horas que dura y no se hace pesado en ningun momento. 

Juego casual y divertido, que ni mata ni engorda pero que se deja jugar bastante bien. 

P.D: Cuidado con los Annunakis Reptilianos... que estan por todos lados.  


6/10.

21949427.review:
Die Küstendorf Serpent Creek steht Kopf! Eine Reporterin verständigt in großer Angst eine Privatdetektivin um sie und ihren Fotograf zu retten.

In '9 Clues' bewegen wir uns in den Schuhen einer paranormalen Detektivin durch das an einer Küste gelegene Serpent Creek. Wie der Name schon suggeriert, wimmelt es in diesem Dorf vor Schlangen, was die wenigen Bewohner kaum zu stören scheint. Die Einwohner benehmen sich sonderlich und erinnern beinahe an Zombies - gruselig.

Unsere Aufgabe für uns durch verschiedenste Teile des Orts und lässt uns in klassicher Adventure-Manier Rätsel- und Logikausgaben erfüllen. Die typischen Wimmelbilder dürfen wir dabei auch durchwühlen, wobei sich diese in Grenzen halten und nur an sinnvollen Stellen auftauchen. Bei der Schwierigkeitstufe des gut 3-stündigen Abenteuers darf man eine sanfte Steigerung erwarten, doch Kopfnüsse findet man hier nicht. Hilfen finden sich in Form des integrierten Tipp-System und dem Aufgabenbuch. Die Weltkarte ermöglicht ebenfalls wichtige Punkte zu identifizieren. 

Grafisch ist der Titel schön anzuschauen, kann aber nicht mit den großen Eigenproduktionen von Artifex Mundi mithalten. Bei der Vertonung kommen stimmungsvolle Umgebungsgeräusche zum Einsatz, welche mit guten Sprecheinlagen untermalt werden.

Freunde von Wimmelbildspielen im Stil von Adventures werden hier ihren Spaß haben. Anspruchsvoll wird das Abenteuer zwar zu keiner Zeit, aber für einige entspannte Abende oder einen gemütlichen Sonntag, ist das Spiel bestens zu empfehlen.

The achievements in the game are very easy to get and the game has an interesting game mode called "detective mode" in which you have to identify proofs of a crime in a crime scene to reconstruct the actions of the criminal. Very interesting.

21149180.review:
9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek - это детективный квест, действие которого разворачивается в середине 1950-х годов в США, в отдаленном городке под названием Серпент-Крик, где бесследно пропала известная журналистка. Игроку в лице частного детектива предстоит найти ее, исследовав весь город вдоль и поперек.

Жуткая игра  немного Скалли и Малдера, нужно каждый раз спешить на помощь друга, и сразу же в расследование странных событий, хаос и убийства происходят в небольшом прибрежном городке. Большое множесто жутких локаций  эксцентричные и хитрые персонажи, которые отговаривают вас, или просто закрывают глаза на то, что происходит на самом деле в городке. 

Итератив впечатляет, он очень уникален. Вы все время будете думать что вот вот раскрыли и знаете кто главный антагонист но нет, повторяя шаги и собирая фрагменты подсказки в едино. Безусловно, есть скрытые задания. Продуманные головоломки, а также музыка и эффекты они прекрасны, как всегда на высшем уровне. Внешний вид и ощущение от игры богаты с точки зрения цветовой гаммы. Сюжет сильный и не забываемый.

21100427.review:
TL;DR not only minigames, graphic, sound and story are good, even very little details are polished - even in ending credits you can use scroll!


As you can read from most reviews graphic and story are good blah blah. It's true but for me very important are details in such game. 

Like for example that you can exit a "zoom in" by clicking anywhere not only down (all navigating is very intuitive) or when you talk with somebody only their sentences show up, you won't lose time for hearing obviosus things from your character.

Level of difficulty (on expert of course, why would any1 play this game on lower?) is perfect, you won't lose much time in hidden objects game while they are much more rewarding then in other games, mostly because of 1-2 items that need your interaction to find them like you need to take stamp, put it in ink, make stamp on paper and take that stamp.

Used object that you won't need anymore disappear from eq, so you won't be confused.

Besides hidden objects minigame there are "find clues" minigame in which you don't see name of what you should find, but you need to figure out what can be clue, which is not very difficult but very rewarding.

Also there are other puzzles, all well thought, with nice graphic for some jigsaw puzzle and nice ideas like trying to put connected points on board so connections don't cross each other.

Amount of "wtf i should do now" is low and usually short. Good thing this game is about figuring out things, not figuring out what developer wanted us to do.

Oh and soundtrack is very good imo, really good match for this game.

The best game of this type I've played so far.

21012237.review:
[i]9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek[/i] is another Artifex Mundi game – one of their early productions, working with a young developer team: Tap It Games. It is a decent HOG to keep you busy for 2-3 hours straight with a subtle taste for noire. It is not exceptional compared to the rest of Artifex Mundi collections, but it is refreshingly well-done for the HOG genre itself anyway.

Our character, a lady private eye comes to the little town of Serpent Creek to investigate the disappearance of her journalist friend, Helen during Serpent Creek's famous Serpent Festival. We are quick to notice that there is an obscene amount of serpentine references going about the town; alongside mysterious disappearances, earthquakes and zombie-like citizens. The story gets more and more complicated between a moody hotel manager, a veteran sheriff, a suspicious British guest and a disturbingly oblivious mayor... What to do?

While the character modelling is appealing in animation, the psychological portrayal and demeanor designs of characters especially take the cake on this one. They are definitely interesting and elegant enough to keep you interested with the story revelation. People look and act similar to cover arts for classical Nancy Drew books with an extra dose of eerie and suspicion about them. You keep second guessing about characters, tying them to any kind of dreadful business the moment you see them. I won't lie, the outcome is not extraordinary, yet the display is certainly worth your time. The background artwork is also pretty and comes strong on establishing atmospheres. 

The game contains some of the more imaginative puzzles that I've encountered within genre, alongside some entertaining lock picking puzzles. What I especially liked was investigation scenes where we are expected to pick up some clues around to deduce the recent happenings within the room. Hidden object scenes were ordinary if not a bit too easy. The usage of the map, action indicators and its teleportation feature are all present to bring you a relief for achievement hunting.

All in all, the game is worth the money for a HOG gamer, or anyone looking for a time kill with both noire and mystical atmosphere. If it is on sale, even better.

Please also check out Lady Storyteller's Curator page [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ladystoryteller#curation]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

[h1]Очень неплохая игра в жанре «Я ищу»[/h1]

По сюжету, подруга-репортерша приглашает нас в городок Серпент крик, где творятся непонятные вещи. Когда мы прибываем туда, то не можем найти ни подругу ни её помощника. Нам предстоит выяснить, куда они подевались, что случилось с жителями города и почему там так много змей. Сюжет хоть и простой, но в меру насыщенный – будут и погони и плен и даже стрельба :)

Игровой процесс классический – бродим, ищем вещи, применяем их. Сцены поиска простые, даже слишком, все предметы хорошо видны. В игре есть занятный режим детектива, когда надо найти улики, а по ним героиня восстановит, что произошло. Он тоже очень простой, но интересный.

Картинка в игре приятная, на четверочку. Темновато, как в большинстве подобных игр. Персонажей много, но анимация практически отсутствует.

Игру рекомендую поиграть. Она небольшая и ощущения, что зря потратил время не возникает.

20549662.review:
In 9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek you play as a detective that drove to a town called Serpent Creek in order to help Helen, a friend who is also a reporter. During the story you are going to witness odd things that you can’t really explain while also meet strange characters who speak in an odd way or just show a strange behavior. 

In order to advance in the story you will have to get certain items weather to unlock doors, cut fences or disable some switches. To get these objects you must play a classic hidden object mini-game every now and then or you may have to solve puzzles who may test your intellect but in the end you won’t have to struggle much to understand them. It is possible to choose the difficulty setting to your liking so that you can go through the game without worrying about penalties if you click on the wrong object for instance. Contrary to what the creator states in the “Features” page of the game, the game really gives you a big clue of who is the bad guy and who’s not so don’t mind the “Breathtaking plot full of unexpected twists” because the plot is really easy to follow and it’s really obvious about the main villain.

If you want some light-gaming experience and you like to solve mysteries, with some side puzzles, the game can offer you around 2-3 hours if you play at a normal rate. There’s no replay value unless you missed some clues and want to go back and start again in order to find them all.

20481740.review:
Eh not bad i guess.

I don't have a lot of experince with hidden object games but i've been curious about them and this happend to be my first and all and all not a bad experince.

You play some kind of detective searching for her lost friend in a creppy town with a thing for snakes.  You search the area, solve simple but fun puzzles and go through several hidden object segmeants and end up getting caught up in a lovecraftian mystery, albeit Yig instead of Cuthulu.  

The art in the game is colorful (despite the whole thing taking place at night) and everything is well drawn.  The voice acting is nothing to write home about but its not terrible.  Overall its presented very well.

As far as adventure games go this one was pretty easy but still enjoyable. part of what makes most point and click games hard is trying to figure out what items and in what order your suppose to use them in.  Its pretty obvious what your supposed to do with most objects in this game but i find that rather refreshing given how mind bogglingly stupid some of the puzzles in other adventure games can be.  

The game is aimed at more casual players.  If your ever lost you can look at your map to show you where theres a puzzle you need to solve and if your still stuck there is a recharging hint system.  That being said the game is pretty easy and can be beaten in about 3 hours without hints.  Also several puzzles are used mulitipule times and each hidden object location is used twice just with a new list of items.  

The story is decent.  theres a small cast of colorful characters to interact with and the plot throws some twists and turns here and there but don't expect anything amazing.  Without spoiling anything you'll usally be able to tell who the bad guys are just by looking at them.  so the story feels kinda like a scooby doo mystery.  fun but nothing ground breaking. 

Again i don't play many hidden object games so i can't really tell how it stacks up to others but judging it just as an adventure game i had fun.  Its got just enough challenge to give your brain a stretch without ever feeling like a pain.  give it a play if your looking for a lite adventure game.  though i don't know if i'd chose this as a launching point to test the waters of hidden object games.

19833769.review:
Искренне не понимаю, откуда такие высокие оценки.
Игра начинает раздражать еще с меню. Такое чувство, что случайно подцепил печально известный тулбар, или завелся амиго. 
Головоломки однотипны и скучны, поиск предметов слишком прост.
Сюжет банален до безобразия. Нам звонит подружка и мы бежим её спасать, ведь мы – героический частный сыщик. Как только мы попадаем в город, встречаем местного Волдеморта. [spoiler] Серьезно, хоть кто-то не понял, что главный злодей - мужик со змеиным лицом? [/spoiler]
Всю игру не покидает мысль, что местные жители поголовно безрукие дурачки (один из них даже в прямом смысле). [spoiler] Злодей забравшийся в номер, умудрился порвать штору, опрокинуть стул, оставить след руки на обоях и порвать фото, за которым он, собственно, и явился. Это что за неудачник такой? А вот местный коррупционер хранит награбленное в своем личном кабинете. В мешочке. Гениально! [/spoiler] Я понимаю: жанр обязывает этих несчастных оставлять улики, но настолько тупить? Это уже Эребор. 
Ладно, игра же не про это. Тут мы (в теории) должны любоваться красивой картинкой и разглядывать окружение. Но как-то не особо-то и хочется, ведь картинка не такая уж и привлекательная. Самым симпатичными персонажем является тот же Волдеморт, ведь ему по канону положено быть странноватым. А больше всех пугает подруга. На её фоне даже Джабба Хатт покажется принцессой Леей. Может наша героиня по этой причине с ней и дружит? Себя-то мы в зеркало не видели.
Из этого великолепия радует только относительная логичность использования предметов. Если есть замок - значит есть ключ. До всего легко додуматься, или даже сделать на автомате. Другие игры жанра бывают этим больны: объедини веревку и мыло, и получишь нож-отмычку.
Собственно, чего я так цепляюсь к стандартному Point & Click? Да потому что он стоит 249 рублей! За такую цену я жду, как минимум, чуда. [spoiler] А получаю убийцу-дворецкого. [/spoiler]
Если вы ищите игру на вечер, обратите внимание на Dracula's legacy. Она часто бывает на распродаже, да и стоит без скидки куда как меньше. Всё те же головоломки и поиски, только красиво и не так безлико.
Итак, мой вердикт:
Брать только если все другие игры жанра пройдены и сие творение на распродаже.
4 змеиных укуса в шею из 10.

19557619.review:
[h1]9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek[/h1]

[b]Game Synopsis:[/b]

In [i]9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek[/i], you play as unnamed detective who receives an urgent phone call from long-time friend Helen asking for you to save her.  As soon as you make it to Serpent Creek, you are met with the strange and supernatural when a serpentine creature smashes into the windshield of your car.  This sets the tone for the rest of the story as you journey from location to location searching for clues regarding Helen’s disappearance and the strange behavior of the locals.

[b]Difficulty[/b]

There are three difficulty settings.  On easy, the hidden object puzzles and detective puzzles are pointed out to you with particle effects, while on hard, you receive very little information from your mouse cursor.  The description also says there is a penalty for misclicks on hard difficulty, but even when I spam clicked during the puzzles, I did not see a penalty of any form, so I can’t really attest to what that means.  Lastly, there is a clock on the user interface (UI) that allows you to skip puzzles or receive hints.  Supposedly this takes a very long time to recharge on hard mode, but it did not have a noticeable impact on gameplay, and I did not think the game was difficult enough to even warrant using it.

[b]User Interface (UI)[/b]

The user interface is simple, easily controlled, and excellently laid out in the help/tutorial menu.  The only complaint is that it can seem a bit large, cramping the screen (and I play on a large monitor).  However, it is not an issue that I thought was pervasive enough to be a hindrance in any form.  Also, many of the conversations and cuts scenes are skippable, so that is a plus (especially on your second or third playthrough).

[b]Replayability[/b]

This game has limited replayability.  On all three difficulty levels, the storyline and puzzle progression is exactly the same.  Therefore, replaying the game is not very useful, save to get the accomplishments you did not get on the first play through.  The hardest accomplishment is the 9 hidden clue icons you collect throughout the game, and a replay is almost a necessity as some clues are in areas you can only enter once.

[b]Time / Money / Enjoyment Ratio[/b]

This game retails for $10 USD.  I played through the game in one sitting for what was probably about four to five hours (first play through on hard difficulty, if on easy, probably would have been a bit shorter).  This tells me the game was about $2 / Hr., which is a decent value.

However, I am very miserly in my video game purchases waiting for really good deals before I decide to purchase a game.  If I came across this game for $10, I probably wouldn’t purchase it regardless of the reviews.  I simply cannot justify to myself $10 for something I will play once and then forget about.  So how did I come about this game?  There is currently an Artifex Mundi bundle from bundlestars.com for roughly $2.50.  For this price, the game is definitely worth its cost.


[h1]Summary:[/h1]

9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek is a short but fun point and click adventure with an atmospheric vibe.  It is not scary, or unsettling (unless you are ophidiophobic of course), but it is not campy either.  It doesn’t try to be the game of the year, but it is solid.  The story is thought out, the controls are very to use, the graphics are pleasing (the hand brush painted type of graphics where there’s not so much animation, but rather layering images on top of each other in sequence), and most importantly, there are very few to no glitches (I heard someone say something about one in Linux, but I’m Win7).  This was a fun break from other types of games and gave me an enjoyable morning.

I recommend this game if you can find a deal on it, or if $10 is not an issue for you.  Again, this is not because there is anything wrong with the game, just that it is short and has limited replay value.

Thanks for reading!

19473820.review:
Artifex公司我玩的第5作，先谈剧情，一句话概况：记者年少无知被诱骗遭触手蛇人监禁凌辱还将闺蜜好友拖下水。那镇长，我一眼就看出，这货绝对不是个好人，这货绝对不是个好人，这货绝对不是个好人，重要的话说三遍，带着有色眼光和上帝视角的我玩起来自然没什么阻碍，另外最后虽然弄了一个BOSS跑了的画面，但是看这尿性十有八九不打算再出续作了，当然你如果打我脸了我还是得买。9线索里面的侦探模式虽不说眼前一亮，但最起码的给我玩出了些新意出来，不错。

以下是关于Artifex在STEAM上的所有解密游戏的通用游戏内容评价：没错，你没看错，是通用的，不管是恐怖传奇还是时间之谜又或者是深海恶梦乌鸦森林以及单独作品精神圈套发条传说黑暗迷失等等，他们都是可以套用这套评价的。（1）无聊透顶的贴图式寻物（这已经被业界所有解密游戏学了个透，有意思么？）（2）看RP的随意按物品，这么多作品就没一个不一样的，顶多就是灯泡变石头，按钮变操纵杆，魔法阵变电线，骨子里面一模一样。（3）五角星移动东西，管你放什么东西，反正就给你一个空位，然后一开始东西就是不一样，你爱放什么放什么。（4）但凡是给你一个锁，无非是这么几种情况，锁生锈了，要去找机油。锁的非常结束，要你去找电锯或者焊枪。锁没钥匙，你要去另外一个带锁的地方找那把钥匙。（5）有中文是非常好，这点非常有良心，我说的大实话，你看看解密游戏带中文的STEAM上能有几家（还有一家公司我忘记叫啥了，开头两条狗那个也出过中文的，但是质量之糟糕，我是抱着怎样的心态去玩的啊！）但是，但是，Artifex公司每作都要翻错，多义词也就算了，翻错是怎么个概念？你们那的汉化人员都是用谷歌翻译然后黏贴的么？（6）非他娘的要用焊枪开门，非要用胡桃夹子夹核桃，娘希匹的我手上有把大锤啥不能弄，我手拿一把物理系圣剑你跟我说不能干这不能干嘛，我艹，你干脆让我把它丢了好不好。（这条吐槽只是吐槽下不爽，别无他意，非针对Artifex一家）
剩下的什么国际象棋走马，场景物品互动，各种换着花样的拼图依然是拼图，各种换着花样的放自己家亲戚然后依然是拼图， 各种华容道一样的拼图依然是拼图——也是华容道…………此类种种，不一一列举。
出这么多年一点新意都没有，我也是几乎玩遍Artifex公司所有解密游戏的一位普通玩家了，楞是从黑灯瞎火乱点到了现在不看任何剧情和提示都知道手上这东西要干嘛干嘛找东西都不用睁大眼睛看关键词凭直觉就能找到至少一半以上的物品。哎，Artifex公司你长点心吧…………
然后最后我依然推荐这款游戏，因为我不是个黑，我只是希望Artifex公司能越做越好

19280508.review: A bit short, and a bit easy, but otherwise a very solildly done HOG with a fun story. I enjoyed it.

19262650.review:
I'd never played a Hidden Object Game before, but saw this in a bundle of similar games by the same studio and thought I'd give it a try. I enjoyed it a lot more than I expected!

9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek is basically a fairly simple and linear adventure game (get items, use them on things, solve puzzles, advance a story) interspersed with occasional scenes where you have to click on specific objects in a pile of random junk. It's very well paced, and not at all frustrating or tedious like many adventure games. The story is basically an episode of Scooby-Doo, but that's okay.

I only really have one problem with this game. Sometimes you have to do a hidden object puzzle more than once to get all the items you need from it. This is really unintuitive, because the puzzle isn't available to try again until after the game decides you need the second item from the puzzle.

There are other minor annoyances, like solutions to puzzles being a little eyeroll-inducing, but that's characteristic of the genre. Overall, this is a pretty decent adventure game and a great way to spend a few hours.

19259128.review: I've been meaning to try some Artifex Mundi games for a while and I'm not disappointed. The Secret of Serpent Creek gave me exactly what I expected: a short puzzle-filled adventure, with nice hand-drawn visuals. Gotta admit that some plot points were shaky to say the least, but nonetheless, this has been a nice, relaxing puzzle romp in Lovecraft Lite style.

19247503.review:
这款游戏算是剧情比较短的，大约2个小时左右就可以通关。还是一成不变的解密找物模式，惯用的剧情模式，让玩家第一次见到镇长就知道是最终BOSS。

这关剧情还不错，也不算恐怖（我已经养成了玩 Artifex Mundi游戏时在开门、开箱子时调小音量、远离屏幕的习惯了）

这是我第一个几乎不用重新来就能完成全成就的Artifex Mundi游戏。这个游戏的找东西比较简单，基本随手乱点一通都能找到大半，而且成就里没有不使用提示的这一条，所以可以放心大胆的用提示了。但是有不使用跳过的成就，而游戏中的开锁非常麻烦，一个不小心可能就很难调整回来了。我在这里写一下开锁的方式吧。左边的按钮是A，右边是B——
第一个开锁：ABBAA   AABBB AA
第二个开锁：ABAAB
第三个开锁：ABBAB    ABBBB    BBABB
如果有更简单的欢迎评论指正！

⑨个线索物品的位置：
1.酒店走廊墙上的画上
2.悬崖的月亮上
3.博物馆楼梯下方右边一个蛇头上
4.图书馆旧书区窗子墙上
5.酒店管理员房间里人偶衣服上
6.墓地大门左墙上
7.庄园地下室推车上
8.控制室指表盘上
9.博物馆一楼画像左胸

最后吐槽一下游戏的人设——是在太丑了！不论是反面人物还是姬友海伦（游戏里的大妈音一听就软了啊有木有！）。多好的百合主题！如果是11区做的游戏，一定会把海伦画成萌萌的软妹子，让玩家看一眼就有想尽快拯救她的欲望，而且声优会用非常甜美的萝莉音。[spoiler]通关之后搞不好还会有主角和海伦两个妹子滚床单百合的18X场景咕嘿嘿嘿嘿……[/spoiler]

Decent game.   Delivers what you'd expect, search for items in the environment, use them, a few solvable mini games, and a bunch of Hidden object puzzles.  

Story line is decent and plays out well.    There's no useless back tracking and the story leads you properly so that you're not clicking on every place on map randomly to figure out what's next.   

My one complaint would be the Hidden object puzzles - everything is in plain sight and thus much too easy - most HOB games try to blend the items into the environment making it somewhat challenging to locate at least a few items every scene.   This game does not.  

Overall a decent game.

18452402.review:
Vorwort:

In "9 Clues: Das Geheimnis von Serpent Creek" schlüpfst Du in die Rolle eines Detektives und fährst nach Serpent Creek.  Deine Ankunft wird von einem seltsamen Wesen beschattet. In der Stadt angekommen begegnest Du aber noch vielen weiteren mysteriösen Gestalten. Die Gefahr ist sein Beruf und als Detektiv mit besonderen Fähigkeiten machst Du dich ohne Skrupel daran, die dunklen Machenschaften zu durchkreuzen und eine düstere Verschwörung aufzudecken. 

Während den Ermittlungen in der Stadt, stolpert der Spieler neben dunklen Ecken und spurenreichen Tatorten auch über viele Wimmelbilder und Minispiele, deren Lösungen gut machbar sind. Falls man nicht weiter weis,gibt es einen Tipp Button,dieser zeigt Dir den nächsten Hinweis und ladet sich nach einer gewissen Zeit wieder auf. Die Dauer der Aufladung kommt aber auf den von Dir gewünschten Schwierigkeitsgrad an. Es gibt auch viele nützliche Gegenstände, wie z.B. eine Stadtkarte, ein nützliches Inventar und ein Tagebuch, die sich jederzeit einsehen lassen und man somit bestens gerüstet ist,um das Abenteuer erleben zu können. Wolltet ihr schon einmal in die Rolle eines wahren Deketives schlüpfen,dann habt ihr nun die Möglichkeit,den das Abenteuer enthält neben fesselnden Momenten auch noch die "9 Clues". Damit sind jeweils neun Hinweise an einem Tatort gemeint, die von Dir gefunden und in ablaufender Reihenfolge angeklickt werden müssen, um den Tathergang wiederzugeben und Dir ein genaueres Bild davon zu machen.

Fazit: 

"9 Clues: Das Geheimnis von Serpent Creek" ein wirklich tolles Wimmelbildspiel geworden,das aus einem Gesamtpaket aus Story, Rätseln, Deketivarbeit und Grafik besteht.

J'ai bien aimé ce jeu, j'aimerais voir la suite, d'autres histoire de cette détective.
