18154589.review:
Remember when you were a kid, flipping around channels late at night and landing on some weird 80s horror movie with terrible everything? Well, this is that movie, just with clicking on lots of items. Serpent Creek is a pulpy adventure to find your reporter friend in a weird little seaside town where everyone acts like a creepy asshole. In stark contrast with Haunted Past, this game is heavy on stingers and jumpscares but they're so goofy they become endearing. There's plenty of hilarious adventure game logic too, like needing an axe to chop up a little branch you could step over, using a knife to open a can of soda so you don't ruin your nails (pictured), and the classic "use gun on man" puzzle solution more than once. I really can't overstate the charm on display here, and the puzzles and item searches are mostly easy enough to keep the game rolling. The only times I got stuck were specifically because I chose the hardest difficulty where it does not highlight hidden object scenes for you, which is a problem because for some reason this game makes you do every scene twice at different points in the story. A strange annoyance, but not enough to hurt my opinion of the game.

There are investigation scenes as well where you click on 9 pieces of evidence and then listen to your character narrate an absolutely ridiculous series of events. There's voice-acting set to the Flash-level animation and it is just as goofy and terrible as it needs to be. The puzzles are pretty standard adventure game fare, minus really obnoxious ones like sliding blocks. The map is helpful, and the graphics are crisp enough to make out everything you need. I enjoyed this one quite a bit, and it even clocked in over the usual 2-hour mark.

18148446.review:
Is this game good enough to recommend? Yes.
Is it as good as some of the other Artifex Mundi hidden object games? ...not really, no.

You're a private investigator coming to the sleepy town of Serpent Creek to find her friend that is a reporter.
The problem I have with the game is pretty much in the title already. What could be the secret of Serpent Creek?

Well, it's snakes. Sorry if this is a terrible spoiler for you, but it's [b]right there[/b] in the name of the game.
The rest of the plot basically plays out on automatic as well. The people that look shifty turn out to be the villains, the ones that look friendly or attractive are helping you in the end.
It flaunts its new "Detective Mode" which is little more than a mini-game a few times throughout the story that has you piece together what happened in a location. It's neat enough, but far from ground breaking.

So what's left? A decent hidden object game. Nothing spectacular, nothing out of the ordinary, but well executed with high production values like those you've come to expect from Artifex Mundi.
If you've exhausted their other games I would recommend it, but it's not their best game by a long shot.
If you haven't played their other games, perhaps start with [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/MaraKalat/recommended/259740]Nightmares from the Deep[/url] instead.

至于趣味性来说，我是觉得不错的，不俗的谜题数量，然后引人入胜的剧情，也给这款游戏大大加分，不过因为考虑到游戏可能会有第二部，所以结尾看起来会比较烂尾，比较没有结尾的那种亡命天涯然后反杀boss的感觉。
总结来说还是一款不错的解谜类游戏，在这种类型里面可以算得上是上品了，但是作为这间公司的作品，我觉得只能算中规中矩。
最后请大家务必去玩一下！
【另外：翻译有个地方非常坑人，钉子翻译成蜗牛了。。。

17978831.review:
I never played 'hidden object' games before, this game is in my collection because of a sale where i got a lot of these games for 2 euro. At that price, you can take a risk, i played this one first because it came up on top of my steam games list (because it starts with '9').
Not knowing what to expect, i was rather surprised by this game. The graphics are decent, the music and sound is good and the voice acting is very well done. It felt like playing an adventure game the first 10 minutes, because it has these elements of putting things in your inventory and using/combining them with other objects to make progress in the game and advance the story. However, soon enough you run into these 'hidden object' games, which i don't see the point of. You're presented with a list of objects and you have to find them, when you complete this task, you get a new object in your inventory you need to get further along the game. There are also puzzles to be found, you know the kind, activate all lights by turning the dails, arrange this or that without crossing other bits, ... After playing it for an hour or so, it started to feel more like a very light version of Nintendo's Professor Layton series (i say 'light' because it's not as good).
The story is very very predictable and so are the actions you have to take to advance. They are not hard as in real adventure games, which could have you scratch your head for days (back in time, when there was no internet yet and you couldn't look up the solution).
What is left is a very well made and executed game that is rather simple and so falls more in the casual gaming field (at least that is how feel about it). I was not bored by it, though it was easy to complete and was short, buy it only if on sale.
Works without any problems in SteamOS, quick loading, no glitches.

17909076.review:
9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creep ist eine Mischung aus Wimmelbild wie Point 'n Click Adventure. In Serpent Creek scheint es wie ausgestorben und die letzten Bewohner, die dort noch ihr Unwesen treiben, scheinen verrückt, kaum ansprechbar. Wir selbst spielen Detektiv und versuchen dem Geheimnis des Dorfes nach zu kommen. Trink bloß nicht die schwarze Mamba und vertrau nicht auf den Bürgermeister. Oder den Polizisten. Vielleicht stecken am Ende irgendwie alle mit drin?

[+]
□ interessanter Comic-Stil (Bild pro Bild wird angezeigt, keine fließende Bewegung)
□ Gute Vertonung (Dialoge, Soundtracks wie Musik)
□ nette Rätsel, die man überspringen kann, falls man die Geduld verlieren sollte
□ Es gibt eine Fortsetzung der Reihe
□ packende Gesichte/ Atmosphäre gut aufgebaut und gehalten

[-]
□ hat sich sehr schnell durch spielen lassen
□ manche Rätsel sind schon arg leicht
□ Preis-Leistung ist ein wenig unausgeglichen

Fazit:
Ein schönes Spiel für den Zeitvertreib, wer generell auf Wimmelbild-Spiele steht wird voll auf damit zufrieden sein. Viele verschiedene Rätsel sind vorhanden, die aber teilweise schon sehr leicht werden können. Rätsel-Profis sollten den schweren Schwierigkeitsgrad wählen, wenn ihr etwas anspruchsvolleres sucht. Ein Kauf lohnt sich auf jeden Fall.

17886749.review: 这款游戏的核心就是找找找，跟着剧情和提示，一步步地解开谜题，不会失败也没有分支，侦探就是这样炼成的。自带中文，全程配音，场景绘制精美，悬疑气氛营造很独特，背景音乐更是恰到好处。剧情相比该制作组的其他作品稍显平淡，可能故事还没有讲完吧，将剩余部分留到了下一个作品。有慈善包，推荐一试。

17812823.review:
9 Clues is another decent HOG from this publisher, with a decent story with a fantastic horror theme (although it is no detective story - who is behind it all is very obvious from about the second location, despite you then "save his life" a couple of times afterwards). The HOG scenes all are well designed and play fine, the point and click sections all tend to make sense and flow naturally, and the characters you interact with are mostly done well, if somewhat cliche in parts.

The puzzles show a reasonable variety, although they tend towards the easy side mostly, it is unlikely you will need to skip any. One thing to note is that some locations are only accessible at certain parts of the story and then get locked back out again for the rest of the game, so if you are trying to get the ? achievement you need to be sure you have checked everywhere before you move forward, or you may have to replay most of the game to get that last achievement (museum and library are the two I missed I think), and it isn't like these games have much replayability.

Anyway overall, a good entry in the genre, maybe a bit too easy in places, but the somewhat above average story helps make up for that.

17763621.review: I'm recommending "9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek," but not at the current list price.  It's a decent Artifex Mundi casual adventure Hidden Object Game (HOG) that's got acceptable graphics and voice acting for its genre.  But, the story is very simplistic and the HOGs, themselves, very simple to do.  The worst thing I can come up with to complain about is that the Detective Mode scenes are just silly.  They're sort of a reverse HOG:  you find things that look odd in a scene and it fills in the name down below.  The silly part is that the main character then uses those objects to come up with what happened in the scene.  And, she's just pulling that stuff out of her posterior dorsal when she does.  The sole reason I don't recommend the game at its current list price is its length:  it took me 3.3 hours to finish the whole thing with 100% Achievements.  If you can find the game on sale for about $3, go for it.  Otherwise, it's just not worth it.

17515166.review:
I'm not the sort to prejudice games over things like their being hidden object puzzlers; and the Artifex Mundi games are by far the best examples of the genre. Nonetheless A.M. has followed the method of if it isn't broke don't fix it, meaning they reuse their puzzles with cosmetic variations from one game to another. This has the unfortunate result that if you've played one of their games you've played them all.

That's O.K. if you think of the games as more visual novels with bonus puzzle content. Granted the writing isn't amazing; but it isn't bad either. I know I've yet to play an A.M. game I could make myself stop playing before the end. That's, on average, over 3 hours in one sitting. And, most of their games include a bonus chapter that extends gameplay another hour.

They do manage to do this without unnecessarily padding game length that overstays its welcome. I know that doesn't sound like much in an industry with triple AAA titles that boast hundred of hours of gameplay. But, for cheap casual games this is an achievement.

My recommendation, because of the "if you've played one you've played them all" problem, is pare your selections down to their better games. That would be Enigmatis 2 (but not the mediocre Enigmatis: the Ghosts of Maple Creek) as a top pick, Grim Legends 1 & 2 if you liked that, and the Nightmares from the Deep trilogy if you just can't get enough of these games.

17514432.review: Another enjoyable hidden object game from Artifex Mundi. After the last one I played (Time Mysteries), this one was much better. Not their best, but still a good hidden object game. I liked the story, although I'm not too happy with the ending since it felt unresolved. Still, the story was interesting and the gameplay was good (although the lockpicking achievement was frustrating as I had to start a new playthrough just for it). Anyway, I recommend this one but I still think their Grim Legends games are their best.

17511408.review:
9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek es un juego de objetos ocultos (HO) bastante entretenido, aunque muy inferior a otros títulos del mismo género como la serie Enigmatis o Dark Arcana. Se nota que la mano de Artefix Mundi no está en el desarrollo del juego.

El juego nos plantea una historia de una detective que ha de viajar a un pueblo donde se celebra todos los años el festival de la serpiente. Allí intentará buscar a su amiga reportera que ha desaparecido misteriosamente. 

Como tal, la historia no está mal, pero es muy previsible durante casi el mismo inicio de la misma. Desde que comienza la historia, ya sabes quien es el malo, y quien no. Así que los giros argumentales que promete no son realmente tales porque es todo excesivamente simple en su planteamiento, y los personajes son muy planos y sin personalidad ninguna. Sí es cierto que hay una sorpresa durante el desarrollo del juego, algo que mejora la experiencia levemente, pero el resultado final respecto a las sensaciones generales sigue siendo el mismo.

Los puzles HO están a un buen nivel, pero no son nada complicados, y los minijuegos no será nada que no hayas visto con anterioridad. Es decir, no hace el esfuerzo por innovar nada en este aspecto, pero lo que presenta lo hace bien.

Aún así, se nota que se han esforzado en intentar incluir elementos novedosos, como el sistema para descubrir pistas y llegar a deducciones, pero a menos que juegues en el nivel más alto, no lo disfrutarás mucho, ya que hasta en el nivel avanzado, el juego te ayuda demasiado a encontrar las pistas. Este sistema, que a priori podría ser algo bueno, resulta tremendamente absurdo, ya que las deducciones que realiza la detective son inverosímiles, montándose unas películas acojonantes por el hecho de por ejemplo, haber visto una correa, una lámpara y una mancha de sangre. Demasiado absurdo y poco creíble en mi opinión.

En definitiva, 9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek es un juego que cumple pero poco más. Su escasa duración, 3 horas, no nos dejará con ganas de más, al contrario que pasaba con Dark Arcana por ejemplo, dejando una sensación: "Bueno, no es nada del otro mundo, pero algo ha entretenido".

No es especialmente recomendable, pero tampoco te hará daño jugarlo si te gustan este tipo de juegos.

17435994.review:
Had I not played some of the other games from this publisher I actually probably would have enjoyed this a bit more.  It isn't a bad game, and I might put it around 6/10, but since Steam's rating asks specifically: Would you recommend this game?  Well, no, I'd have a hard time actually recommending it to someone to play.

The plot is a bit iffy, but my biggest issue with the game is I felt like there were a number of cases were there wasn't really any logic as to where I should go next.  Rather than encountering a new area and exausting the possible click puzzles until I had everything I needed, I sometimes found myself wandering each section of the map pixel hunting to see if a new hidden object puzzle had come up.  Often there was no rhyme or reason to it, and new puzzles would appear in the same place as old puzzles but now the plot had been advanced and you needed to figure out to check it again.

Maybe this is normal for games in this genre, but I haven't felt that way so far with the other games from Artifex Mundi.

That said, there was enough good in the game that I'm still looking forward to playing 9 Clues 2.

It is not an aweful game. But compared to other hidden-objects games I've played, this one is hardly reaching the average level. First of all, the objects finding seems to be too easy, actually one of the easiest. The objects are big and barely hidden. Players can just randomly click the items without checking the list and get half of them right. It is a major let down. And the plot is too obvious as well. You can easily tell the creepy bold mayor with a snake voice is the criminal here (sorry for the spoiler, but it is just too obvious). And interesting thing, when you analyzed the whole situation in a crime scene and knew the guy has locked the snake in the closet, the following move is of course "Let's see what is in the closet, shall we? it seems so interesting. OMG, it is really a snake, hahaha, oh well, just shoot it with all my bullets." The mini puzzles are way too easy. I guess this game is designed for rookie HO game players aging from 5 - 10. There are supposed to be more lines for the characters when a wrong object is used instead of just "NO!". Com'n just give couple of more minutes. And there are even spelling mistakes in the text. oh well. .. 

If you are a HO games fan, you shall go checking the games on BigFish. They have way more better games.

As any Artifex Mundi, this game is of quality. Unfortunately, I didn't really enjoy it as I should. It was kinda hard to enter the story this time because I have immediately understood who was the culprit, contrary to Grim Legends for example.

I had a problem with one of the HO scenes where, despite clicking on the right item, it wasn't being picked up. I don't know how I managed to get it past (clicking and clicking and finding finally the hitbox), yet, it was frustrating. I don't know if it had been solved or not as I uninstall the game once I got everything I wanted from it.

But despite this, it's an Artifex Mundi game: well polished, well thought, good visuals, good soundtrack and with nice twists.

Given the fact that I've played the game a long time ago, why the review now? Guess what will be released in a few days? 9 Clues 2! It seems a little more darker than the first 9 Clues, more psychological (yay!), so, it was time to put a review for the game :).

Buy it anyway :).

17115319.review:
One of the more 'middle-range' Artifex Mundi hidden object games on Steam. 

I say more middle range because although it is on a newer version of their game engine and has some of the nice more well rounded UI and UX enhancements and very pretty art (other than the characters), I found overall the story/setting and game play to be a bit more stilted and less enjoyable than some of the others. It is nice to see one without a 'Play in expert mode' achievement though.

The games 'unique' element is the detective mode. You are given a hidden object search with 9 'clues', but it doesn't label what they are.. you are given hints in casual and advanced mode via cursor highlights but I imagine this would have been quite hard if you started straight into expert mode as they don't initially make it very clear how it works.. I also found her 'conclusions' based on the evidence found to be extremely hard to believe.. it supports the story but some of it is barely logical =)

I appreciated that the hidden object puzzles all made good use of real word items and for the most part were fairly logical in sizing and placement (objects that would be on a desk were on a desk for example). While games that mix it up can be quite fun (See the Amazing Adventures series by SpinTop/Popcap) it is all good as long as it is consistent and there are some games that just do it for one or two objects which I just find frustrating.. it's not a clever trick.. it just makes the logic of the world seem even more stupid.

While the hidden object games seem logical, most of the other puzzles seem outright bizzare to be fitting into the world and whie there is some supernatural/mythological elements to explain some of these, others just wouldn't make sense beyond 'the game wants me to put this here to open that'.. which I generally don't mind, but when so much else is trying to make sense it comes across a little inconsistent.

Hidden object puzzle to logic/block sliding/roating/other puzzles is probably 3/1ish.. it felt like there were a lot more hidden objects in this one than some of the more recent games - and to be honest it was quite a nice mix. I felt there was an over-use of the rotating puzzle though.

I often find that since these games have introduced the ability to jump between map points quickly and easily (love it) that sometimes, as in this game, I just open the map up each time I do something and jump to the next point with an 'active' flag. This game seemed to have some fairly random non-connected scenes that encouraged this behaviour and once you begin it can be hard to stop. This is in contrast to other examples such as 'Left Behind - No one on board' where it just 'felt right' to navigate naturally between scenes.

Unfortunately there were a couple of scenes that were hard to find. I think this was due to the points on the map being the start of one or two scenes, so there is a marker that there is something to do there, but you can miss the connector to the next scene because unlike the later games not all scenes are accessible from the map. This also results in indoor locations disabling the use of the map - this is different to when they disable selections on the map because it is inaccessible - and it just feels weird to be told.. no.. you're inside the library - you can't go to the museum now unless you walk through three rooms back to the main door and teleport from the street.

STORY INFORMATION FOLLOWS:
I'm not sure if it was the attempt to have the game based in a more 'American' setting and it just coming off wrong or what, but the writing and language used seemed more stilted. Structurally it just felt.. weird. 

There are some unsympathetic sympathetic characers, you can tell from the later notes and things that you are meant to feel bad for their situation and/or that they are trying to make the best of their bad situation but the writing of the notes hidden throughout the game is quite a contrast to the dialogue as though written by two different people who perhaps had different ideas, the dialogue writer making them hard boiled and unforgiving and the note writer trying to justify it but it just doesn't work together.

[Spoiler]
It was also a little strange that you went to help your friend that the bad guy kidnapped for some nefarious purpose - sacrifice/offering? Nope - it's as though last minute he just decided that he should eat her - there seemed to be no point in waiting.. why didn't he eat her before you got there.. unless he wanted to eat you too.. but how would he know you would come.. and there's a whole town full of people under his control he could have eaten - urgh.. this sort of thing annoys me - but I digress.
[/spoiler]

I do sometimes get the feeling in Artifex Mundi hidden object games that I'm meant to have known something before the game tells me, and I activate a puzzle or do something out of order and then it's not until I go and do something else that the 'back story' is filled in and it clicks for me.. which in their newer stuff is handled a lot better.

There were a few instances in this game where it was like 'I need a lens for the projector' which is great and all - but I'm currently at the point where I don't even see a need for the projector itself yet. It felt sometimes like it was taking away my opportunity to go 'AHA - I need to go back to that projector because now I have these slides that will tell me more'.
:STORY INFORMATION ENDS

This is one for those who want more hidden object searches over logic puzzles - there is no way to skip the hidden object searches by substituing mahjong/dominoes etc (as other Artifex Mundi games have done). 

This game is one of the shorter ones that I have played recently, and though I don't think I'll replay it straight away to get the achivements I missed (the hidden ?'s, and the achievement for getting all achievements), it didn't make me feel like I wouldn't want to go through it again in order to do so.

It looks like another 9Clues game will be released soon and having now played this one I look forward to it and am hoping it will make use of some of the UX and story sensibilities of the more recent games.

17024323.review:
Ich spiele total gerne Wimmelbildspiele. Ich hatte mich vorhin noch einmal gefragt warum eigentlich. Ich glaube es liegt daran, dass sie nicht besonders anspruchsvoll sind, aber meistens eine recht interessante Story erzählen. Letzteres ist mir an Spielen soweiso immer am wichtigsten. Zudem ist es so, dass ich täglich sicher 10-12 Stunden arbeite, meistens 6 Tage die Woche und Abends dann keine große Lust mehr habe auf einen AAA Titel, sondern eher noch 1-2 Stunden vor der Daddelkiste entspannen will. Dann kommen solche Wimmelbildspiele immer gut bei mir an, weil sie eben nicht sehr schwer zu lösen sind, ein entspanntes spielen also.

9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek hat mir dabei besonders gut gefallen, weil nicht nur die Story gut erzählt wird, sondern weil sie auch spannend ist. Man will sozusagen die ganze Zeit wissen wie es weitergeht und klickt das Spiel in einem Rutsch durch. Zugegeben, das ist nicht sehr lange, etwa 3 Stunden, aber 3 interessante Stunden. Gut fand ich die Tatsache, dass man im Spiel schon dachte "Jetzt hab ich es gleich durch" also kurz vor dem Ende war und dann doch wieder was überraschendes passiert und man doch wieder in einer neuen Szene steckt. Das hat selbst mich als ü30 Gamer überrascht. 9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek istr also definitiv eines der besseren WImmelbildspiele, die man sich auf jeden Fall mal anschauen sollte.

16507346.review:
Very nice hidden object game. Good art, music and voiceacting. 

You play a young woman who investigates the disappearance of her friend in a creepy town called Serpent Creek. 

The hidden object scenes scenes and other puzzles are pretty good, I didn't have any major problems with anything other than "WHY does this guy have a brain on ice randomly in his car, WHY is she not even questioning it and most importantly WHY does she pick it up even shen it is not usable to her in any way" (not really a spoiler, as it's in screenshot #5 on this steam page) 

The story is pretty good, it feels like a proper murder mystery with a supernatural touch. The detective mode she enters when she finds a scene is interesting and I haven't seen it used in this genre before and makes the game crossover into detective games like Sherlock. There is a collectible in the game and unless you are either very opservant or using a guide it might take more than one playthrough to find them all as some areas are locked off as the story progresses. 

All in all a good game for fans of mystery games and/or HOGs. The story is pretty short, my 3.2 hours are one full playthrough and one rushing through the game to get the last achievements. You may want to buy this on sale for that reason.

16364851.review:
This is a pretty good addition to the HO/adventure genre.  The plot is reasonably good, the music and voice acting are done better than some (not perfect, mind you, but decent), and it's graphically well made.  The "detective scene" portions are, as far as I can tell, unique to this game and it's nice to see some variation in a genre that tends to reuse and overuse the same types of puzzles constantly.

One problem I can see is the length; I clocked in at 2.6 hours with only about 2 of those hours being in the first playthrough (the rest was going back to grab a missed achievement, since I'm crazy like that).  At this short of a play time, it does not warrant the full $9.99 price tag, but if you can find a decent sale, it's completely worth it.

The other potential "con" to the game is that the HO scenes are not at all challenging and the puzzles are also relatively simple to complete.  If you're a veteran HO gamer looking for challenging puzzles, this isn't what you're looking for.  But if you're interested in a casual, simple game that won't take too much brain-power to get through, you'll probably like it.

TL;DR: this a fun, short, and casual game that is worth picking up on sale.

16350945.review:
令人不快。
优点方面，难度适中，如果仔细一些的话，基本一周目就能拿到全成就，和其他一些必须二周目或是强行多周目的游戏相比算得上是比较简单的。
缺点方面，谜题都很基础，没有什么新意，侦探模式虽然有点特别，然而毫无意义，侦探模式给人的感觉就是个可以点击的过场动画，对接下来的解谜并没有什么帮助或是阻碍。你看了看女主神一般但不知道符不符合逻辑的推理，然后没有留下什么印象。
不过这些其实不是最主要的，重点是，如果你怕蛇、讨厌蛇、或者仅仅只是对蛇没好感，请不要尝试。无论是你在行走、解谜还是在寻找物品时，都不时会有蛇的嘶响出现，说实话并不可怕，但是很吵，吵得人心情烦躁。再加上偏粗糙的画面、以及干巴巴的剧情，让人对之后的发展毫无期待。我在玩的过程中只有两个想法“不想玩下去了”以及“怎么还没结束”。
像是两份甜点之间的一杯白水。不能说不好，只能说我见到过更好的。
如果你是解谜爱好者，可以在打折的时候入手一试，不过基本上我是玩过几小时通关之后决定不会再玩一次。

15617018.review:
I've played about half of Artifax Mundi's games and I have to say this one is probably my favorite. It's the right balance of puzzles and mystery with some good "freaky" moments (like pop there's the bad guy in your face). I loved the story line and the constant directional changes in the story so its not predictable too much. Voice acting was amazazing and music draws you into the game. It's also one of those games you feel like you can't stop playing till you find out the ending (kudoos to Arti for that). Things I didn't like, there was maybe 2 gaps in the story that lacked a complete explanation but, they can lead to a sequel (which I sincerly hope there is one). Overall, I rate it a 10/10.

Pros:
-Wonderful story
-Captured mystery to a T
-Excellent voice acting/music
-Easy flow between areas (like you can click on the map to move to an area versus in Abyss where you couldn't, makes the game not seem too draggy or like you back track a lot even if you do).

Cons:
-Needs a sequel

15605650.review: 9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek is a decent entry in the puzzle adventure and find the object casual gaming genre.  To it's credit it supports the Steam Overlay and widescreen resolutions, as well as Steam achievements and Trading Cards.  However, the games plot is somewhat cliched and predictable, despite clever but not too difficult puzzles.  My biggest complaint with the game is it's length.  I completed the entire game in just over 2 hours with 80% of the achievements.  I felt the find the object mini games in particular to be incredibly easy compared to comparable games on the market.  I did not come across any bugs during gameplay and the voice acting was passable if uninteresting.  Overall the game is a fair purchase, but should be avoided by any enthusiast who desires a real challenge or a lengthy adventure.

15519147.review:
This game gives me mixed feelings, so I will be brief:

The artistic direction of 9 Clues is fantastic. Like a lot of HoGs, the visuals are very much high up on the list of important aspects, and here the game does not disappoint.

HOWEVER

With a very thin storyline, and a protagonist who flips between being a detective genius, followed by being a naive victim to quite possibly the worst-kept secret of all in this game: the main antagonist - I find it very difficult to recommend this game to anyone but the most dedicated of HoG-lovers.

Yes, these games don't hinge on storyline, but really what follows when you boot this game is a tiny amount of story, followed by a bout of kleptomania as you 'collect' everything that's not nailed down, and attempt to rescue your friend. The puzzles are fairly straightforward, which is fine - I assume I'm not the target audience here - but often the puzzles have zero bearing on the game's plot, instead just serving as unnecessary hurdles.

I know there are plenty of fans of the genre, and I am - alas - not one of them, as such I am a tad biased.

If you see this game in a sale - do by all means pick it up for a bit of casual enjoyment, but don't expect anything too challenging.

As always - I've documented my progress in the form of a video series:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DETj7h4BHNo

15397969.review: A nice little point-and-click/puzzle game revolving around the sinister happenings at Serpent Creek. The puzzles aren't too hard and the game gives you hints throughout. A very nice little game that'll keep you amused for a few hours.

15330079.review:
You are on a search for your friend who has disappeared.  As you come to Serpent Creek you find the whole town suspicious.  As you solve the mystery of your missing friend, you will also solve the mystery of the town of Serpent Creek.  This is a simple hidden object game with a few simple puzzles.  As far as the genre goes, the hidden object scenes are very simplistic as are the puzzles.  The only tough puzzles were lock pick puzzles, but even these wouldn't take an average player too long to figure out.  The story is interesting and works well and the graphics are decent for this type of game, though do not offer an immense detail as some other games would offer.

Worth the price I paid for the Humble Bundle, so make sure you pick this up cheap if you can find it, and then it's definitely worth the time played.

15193960.review: As one of the earliest Artifex Mundi adventure games, "9 Clues" certainly lacks some of the more impressive elements of its successors. 15172372.review:
As much as I love Artifex Mundi games and the graphics they have in their games, this one left a bad taste in my mouth. 

Don't get me wrong here ; if you want an easy hidden object game with a simple story then this game is for you. However, if you are a fan of ''Nightmares of the Deep'' like me, you will be saddened by this one.

The puzzle were too easy. I felt no challenge and I could almost tell which object I had to click on without looking at the list I had. Second, the story made absolutely no sense and felt sort of rushed. The characters have no background so you don't even know who they are to your character and why they're all in this city. 

--WARNING SPOILER FROM HERE!!!!--

The ''bad guys'' are very predictable. No surprise at all at the ending that also left me really unsatisfied. What also got me frustrated is how, for example, you have to find a way to touch an electrified cable and you need gloves ; you don't even have to look around in the map, it's right next to the electrified cable !! What is the point of having a hidden object game when the objects are not even hidden?

-- END OF SPOILER --

I am really deceived and hope that I will not come across another one like this. If you still want to try this game, I recommend to wait until it goes on sale because it's not worth the full price.

15152083.review:
무려 공식 한글화가 되어 있는 캐쥬얼 퍼즐 게임입니다.

게임 자체는 퍼즐과 어드벤처의 요소가 적절히 섞여있습니다. 그러나 다양한 루트가 있는 것은 아니며, 게임 진행을 위해서는 무조건 정해진 루트만을 가야합니다. 하지만 여기저기 싸돌아다니며 퍼즐 맞추는 재미는 있습니다.

스토리는 정말 별 거 없으며 초중반 즈음 되면 누가 흑막인지 알 수 있을 정도로 등장인물 생김새 특성이 정말 뚜렷합니다.

게임 내에서 3단계의 난이도 조절이 가능하며, 모든 도전과제는 난이도에 상관없이 클리어 됩니다.

머리 싸매고 낑낑대며 푸는 퍼즐이 싫다면 추천합니다.
다만 캐주얼 모드로 하시면 너무 쉬워서 '내가 이걸 왜 하고 있는건가'하고 회의감에 빠질 수 있으니 그 점은 유의하시길.

Mein erstes Wimmelbildspiel, dass ich mir auf Steam gekauft habe.

Die Rätsel sind sehr einfach und viel falsch machen kann man auch nicht, würde es mal als einsteigerfreundlich bewerten. 
Habe am Anfang den Fehler gemacht, die leichteste Schwierigkeitsstufe auszuwählen. Die nervt einen nämlich mit lauter Hinweisanzeigen. Wenn man weiß, wie Wimmelbildspiele funktionieren, kann man ruhig den höchsten "Schwierigekeitsgrad" nehmen.

Dafür gefiehl mir die Geschichte ganz gut. Wer eine kurze Krimigeschichte mit einer Prise Mystik gerne mag, ist hier gut bedient.

Für Zwischendurch ein nettes Spielchen.


EDIT: Die deutschen Übersetzungen sind stellenweise merkwürdig. So wurde offensichtlich aus "tape" im Deutschen ein "Tonband", was ohne Kontext nicht verkehrt sein muss. Gemeint war hier aber ein "Klebeband". Solche Aussetzer gibt es an einigen Stellen.

14558408.review:
Artifex Mundi describe their games as hidden object puzzle adventure games, which is pretty good description. 
As usual for the developer this is story driven game, with many locations where you complete puzzles and hidden object games to unlock items you need to collect to progress. 
If you get stuck the map marks the locations where there are things to do. This can be very helpful as sometimes you need an object from a hidden object game which has been unlocked in a different location from where you are, the map being the only indication that this has happened. Once you get used to checking the map when you think you're stuck it's fine.
As an adventure game it is very easy, although it is enough of an adventure for walkthroughs to be available online if you go looking!

To keep it short - it's interesting enough to not forgot it after first run. I tried it one day and when I was thinking what should I play next day, I just started 9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek again. After that I just knew that I want to know rest of story. Even tho puzzles in game aren't demanding (even without hints), achievements are easy to get and the story itself isn't masterpiece, it's a very enjoyable game.

14401496.review:
Отличная игрушка на расслабление (несмотря на свою мрачную атмосферу и в меру драматический сюжет). Я без напряга поиграла в нее воскресным вечером. Проходится она быстро, не утомляет, что лично меня порадовало.
Рекомендую не начинать игру за новичка, играть сразу на среднем уровне сложности (на высоком и вовсе хорошо). Тогда от игрового процесса будет больше удовольствия.
Лично у меня есть небольшие нарекания к художникам, рисовавшим персонажей. Но на них можно закрыть глаза, это не критичные нарекания)) Правда, если в вас наличествует тяга к прекрасному, то иные рисунки все-таки будут напрягать. Благо что они не так часто мелькают на экране.
Я прошла этот квестик без одной подсказки, хотя не могу назвать себя супер-пупер-разгатывательницей головоломок. Опять же, это расслабляющая игрушка, и быстрое ее прохождение было задумано. Ну и, открывать достижения было приятно.
Кроме поиска предметов, в игре есть всякие разные задачки на сообразительность и логику. Их можно и пропускать, чтобы пройти игру еще быстрее. Хотя мне было интересно с ними повозиться))
Словом, любителям квестов «поиск предметов» рекомендую (главное, не бояться змей)).

14141450.review:
This is actually a pretty swell hidden-object game. If you don't like the genre, this is certainly not going to change your mind, as it's pretty by-the-numbers.
However, it's a well-polished example, and even combines with more point-and-click adventure elements, which are a nice change of pace from hidden-object all day everyday. The music is great and the ambience is unsettling, the graphics are well-drawn and the story, while not great, is decent enough.

It's probably not a game for the "hardcore gamer", as the puzzles themselves are pretty easy, and you should be able to power through them without much trouble. But it's a nifty little game to chill with an afternoon :)

Also, the game - as with many other hidden-object games - is a great way for people not very proficient in English to learn some new words. I spent 5 minutes searching for a fingernail before realizing that "nail" is also something that you can use with a hammer. Yes, I'm an idiot.

On Mac the game seems to have a broken integration with Apple Game Center (so just press 'Cancel' when asked to log in), and once or twice I ran into bugs that actually left puzzles unsolvable, but overall I still recommend 9 Clues for into hidden-object games or "light games" in general.

Ein im Durchschnitt besseres Hidden Object Game, aber leider auch eins der schlechteren guten.
Die Auflösung ist für mich ein großer Punkt bei solchen Spielen, viele bieten nur niedrige oder gar 4:3 Auflösungen an, dieses hier wiederrum war in dem Bereich ganz gut.

Dieses Spiel hat ein paar macken, zum einen fand ich die Geschichte sehr schleppend, die Rätsel waren größtenteils viel zu einfach und der Artstyle gefällt mir auch nicht.
Hidden Object Games, tendieren dazu nicht englisch sprachige Spieler zu verwirren oder Wörterbücher zu benutzen um Objekte zu finden. Dieses Spiel leistet sich in der Deutschen übersetzung leider einige schwere Übersetzungsfehler die ich überhaupt nicht nachvollziehen kann.

Es gibt bessere alternativen. Und davon leider jede Menge.

13604379.review: As usual, I started in Expert Mode, and although I found the Hidden Objects scenes to be pretty easy compared to the studio's other games, the puzzles were the most entertaining by far. I love the detective story, the music and the classy atmosphere (however, I might be biased as I am a sucker for classy detective stories). I also love the geeky references this studio makes in their games (to Call of Cthulhu or BioShock, for instance, or in this case to Ghostbuster and Elvis Presley... although they need to get their time tables right as Elvis was unknown yet by 1953 ;) ).

Foi provavelmente este o atrativo que me fez terminar o jogo, pois o mesmo tem uma temática que eu particularmente não gosto: Terror.
Outro fator relmente importante e que devemos agradecer aos produtores é o fato de ser legendado para o português. Detalhe importate, já que a maioria dos puzzles são de achar itens dentre vários objetos, e certamente é mais fácil achar um isqueiro quando ele tem esse nome.

- If you're deathly afraid of snakes it might give you the creeps.

13334661.review:
Jedna z tych gier gdzie grafika stoi na  drugim miejscu a  liczy się przygoda. W grze wcielamy się w postać pani detektyw specjalizującej się w zjawiskach paranormalnych. Przyjeżdża ona do Serpent Creek na prośbę swojej przyjaciółki Helen Hunter. Po dotarciu na miejsce okazuje się że jej przyjaciółka gdzieś zniknęła a na domiar złego w miasteczku panuje dziwna atmosfera, mieszkańcy  dziwnie się zachowują i nie są skorzy do pomocy. To wszystko zmusza naszą bohaterkę do rozpoczęcia prywatnego śledztwa, które nie jest takie proste jak się początkowo wydaje. Czym dalej brniemy do przodu z naszym śledztwem tym sprawa wydaje się jeszcze bardziej zagmatwana. Na jaw wychodzą mroczne sekrety skrywane przez mieszkańców miasteczka. 

Zagadki które przyjedzie nam rozwiązać opierają się na zasadzie point&click. Zagadek jest sporo począwszy od takich w których trzeba odnaleźć poszczególne elementy i w zamian otrzymujemy jeden który jest przydany w naszym śledztwie, poprzez takie gdzie trzeba odpowiednio operować różnymi przedmiotami a skończywszy na takich w trzeba ułożyć rozsypane elementy w logiczną całość. 

Każda rozwiązana zagadka dostarcza nam niezbędnych wskazówek oraz przedmiotów aby ostatecznie rozwiązać nasze śledztwo, którego rozwiązanie może okazać się zaskakujące. 

Twórcy gry zadbali o to aby każdy znalazł coś dla siebie, gracz może wybrać dla siebie jeden z trzech dostępnych poziomów trudności w zależności od swoich umiejętności detektywistycznych. Gra jest stosunkowo krótka, w zależności od wybranego poziomu trudności zajmuje od 3-5h co jak na tego typu grę  jest w miarę przyzwoitym wynikiem.

Podsumowując, świetna gra na zabicie wolnego czasu. Jeśli ktoś lubi gry detektywistyczne powinien spróbować, na pewno się nie zawiedzie.


[h1]Plus:[/h1]

+ świetna historia
 + zróżnicowane zagadki
+ wciągająca
+ klimat


[h1]Minus:[/h1]

- trochę krótka


[h1]Ocena: 3/5[/h1]

1 – gniot, którego dotknięcie patykiem powoduje długotrwały uraz 
2 – można zagrać ale niekoniecznie 
3 – ciekawa pozycja ale sporo jej jeszcze brakuje do ideału
4 - solidna pozycja, zapewnia świetną zabawę na długie godziny, posiada minimalne błędy 
5 – trzeba zagrać, tytuł zasługujący na miano gry roku

13326627.review:
At this point with a few reviews already under my belt, I've somewhat run out of things to say about hidden object games (or HOGs). With how many there are and the near identical formula used as their base, unless it's appalling or extraordinary I find myself scratching my head for something more elaborate and articulated to say than "it's good for fans of the genre". Artifex Mundi's games however are something of an exception to that rule, as more than most casual developers they've shown a desire to strive to better their games with each release, reusing the same basic template but refining it along the way.

9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek so far as I've explored their catalog is the best example of Artifex taking criticism to heart and using it to turn out a more enjoyable, polished experience. The narrative is a fairly predicable Scooby Doo-esq mystery, in a mysterious town full of odd people that seem just a little too obsessed with snakes. It didn't surprise me, nor is it especially well written, but there's a very typical Artifex charm in the way the story plays out as if they know it's derivative but it's the best they can do so they're still going to give it their all to make it entertaining. The voice acting is a significant step up from what they've managed in the past, perhaps thanks to the fact that the characters presented are so strange that any stilted exchange or bizarre inflection becomes a part of the character instead of sounding like an intern was pulled in at the last moment to record a few lines.

The hidden object scenes themselves, though as usual something of a treat on the side to the main casual adventure game meal, feel more logical in how they're placed and presented. Gone are the random cascades of junk shoved into random corners of the environment, replaced with a handful of scenes that make sense in the narrative (though it's still a little hard to believe anywhere in the world is quite so cluttered with pieces of machinery scattered all throughout the town). And perhaps most worthy of note is the addition of fast travel at long last, which eliminates the tedious back tracking which is already thankfully minimized do to the shorter, but much tighter experience.

So yes, it would be easy to simply say 9 Clues is a great HOG and you should certainly give it a chance whether you're already a fan of the genre of not, but I think it's worth pointing out the areas Artifex Mundi has put in the effort to improve their game in a genre so lacking in inspiration or often considered to be of a high quality. It's going to be hard to go back to their older games I've yet to play, but it also has me excited moving forward seeing how dedicated they are to making their games as excellent as they can be. HOG developers of the world, take note!

13224099.review:
9 Clues é mais um jogo de “Quebra-Cabeças e Objetos Ocultos” lançado pela Artifex Mundi, empresa que vem demonstrando respeito aos jogadores brasileiros ao disponibilizar os seus jogos no no nosso idioma. 

A história consegue prender a atenção ao trazer um clima de mistério (como a maioria dos jogos da Artifex) e um leve toque de terror. É bom observar atentamente o ambiente pois eles têm muitos detalhes e sutilezas, e muitos objetos encontrados em uma cena serão usados em outros lugares no jogo. No decorrer da aventura, ficamos na dúvida se os acontecimentos são armações das pessoas locais ou se realmente são fatos sobrenaturais. 

Os gráficos, apesar de simples, são bonitos e muito bem feitos. A jogabilidade é a que normalmente usamos para estes tipos de jogos, ou seja, apenas no mouse. O jogo é salvo nas “nuvens” e você poderá continuar a partida em outro computador exatamente do mesmo ponto em que parou.

9 Clues não é um jogo difícil, por isso sugiro jogar no modo expert e evitar ao máximo usar as dicas. Principalmente porque é relativamente curto. Joguei a aventura mais de uma vez só para conseguir todas as “Conquistas Steam” e as “Cartas Colecionáveis”.

13086905.review:
----我是感恩节的更新----
这游戏居然75OFF了！让半价买的我情何以堪！差评啊啊啊！！！！！

好吧其实并没有……75OFF的话还是值那个钱的，各位也可以买来冲个成就看看。



---我是原评测---

给好评是因为有中文+半价打折券，没这两点的话这游戏在我玩过的点点点里也就是个中等偏下的水平。

故事非常简单，女主去某小镇找失踪姬友。和所有冒险故事一样，都有个什么神话传说，都有个幕后黑手，最后一定是喜闻乐见的大团圆和Boss高喊 "I'll be back!"。 这游戏基本上看了开头动画和名字就知道结尾，中间有个把地方有点吓人，其它的也没啥了。

除了故事很老套之外，这游戏的画面也略显粗糙（即使是在类似作品中也是相对差的）；音乐和配音……比没有好点吧，至少配音不算生硬；其他的UI什么的也是平均水平。

相比贫瘠的故事表现，这游戏的解谜部分做的可圈可点。游戏名称里的9 clues，代表解谜部分都和9相关：9个主线线索、9个隐藏物品，还有各种小游戏中的9。整个游戏中一共有3类小游戏，除了传统的找东西和解谜之外，独有的侦探模式算是一个亮点（虽然也就是拿鼠标扫屏幕……）。而且谜题相对简单，没什么特别奇葩的谜题，即使开最高难度也能轻松通关（关提示和限时什么的真是太废了），总体来说解谜算是在平均水准之上吧。

怎么说呢……不晓得这游戏有没有登陆移动端，作为PC游戏专门买的话并不是很值；算是个不错的喜+1和刷成就的作品吧。

13076946.review:
9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek to pierwsza gra typu Hidden Object, jaką ukończyłem. Wcześniej zdarzało mi się grywać w dostępne w sieci gry hidden object, ale nigdy nie wciągnęły mnie na tyle, żeby je ukończyć. Właściwie to nie widziałem w nich większego sensu. Dopiero gry od Artifex Mundi zmieniły moje podejście.

9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek to nie tyle czysty "Hidden Object" co lekka, casualowa przygodówka z elementami hidden object. Jest więc fabuła, są ekrany, na których wyszukujemy określonych przedmiotów, są mini-gry logiczne (niezbyt trudne, więc dość odprężające) i dużo ładnych ilustracji, które stanowią tło naszej rozgrywki.

Momentami denerwowało mnie nadmierne rozdrobnienie niektórych akcji (np. włóż klucz do zamka, przekręć klucz, przekręć jeszcze raz, otwórz drzwi) wykonywanych po prostu kolejnymi kliknięciami. Może dodaje to realizmu (?), ale jak dla mnie - po prostu wydłuża rozgrywkę, niewiele do niej wnosząc.

Na szczęście grało się miło, detektywistyczna fabuła z wątkami okultystycznymi skutecznie napędza rozgrywkę. Gra aktorów podkładających głosy ożywia dość statyczną oprawę wizualną, a gra unika monotonii dzięki zmieniającym się elementom rozgrywki - przygodowa, hidden object, logiczne mini-gry.

Gra nie jest długa, więc nadaje się na niewyczerpującą intelektualnie, relaksującą sesję przygodówkową.

TL;DR

Umiejętne połączenie gatunku hidden object z grą przygodową w klimacie detektywistyczno-okultystycznym i logicznymi mini-grami. Ładna oprawa graficzna i porządny voice acting.

The detective scenes are basically glorified hidden-object puzzles, and apparently the main character is a psychic who is perfectly able to recreate crime scenes just by looking at them? 

But eh, that's all minor stuff, really. It's enjoyable enough, the hidden-object scenes are on the easy side, the puzzles are decent, it's a good length, not too long but not overly short either. I wouldn't recommend this one over the other artifex mundi games, though.

13039429.review:
There are two types of HOGs. Strictly HOGs and ones with puzzles added in. This is one that also has puzzles. They aren't difficult puzzles though, and definately won't trip you up much if you're not much of a puzzle solver. I beat this game in about 6 hours, but went back and played it again for the achievements. 
I've played alot of HOGs and am very fond of them, and I can say that this one isn't bad. The artwork of the scenes themselves are good, even if the characters look a bit strange. The story flows nicely, which I find doesn't usually happen in these types of games. There were no lose ends, all the charaters had useful parts, and it didn't leave you wondering about anything (except for the parts that were meant too). They also gave you information in a coherent way. No finding dry documents in a flooded sewer for no reason, or exploring some random strangers house for clues. It was cohesive. It also had an unusual twist on the object hunt scenes by having "detective scenes". These won't be for everyone, but I enjoyed them. 
Only things I can point out as cons are the back and forth between scenes. Lots of clicking all the way across the maps to find one object, then go all the way, use it, go 5-6 scenes to another part, ect... You only really finished with two out of about 15 areas. The only other issue was repeat and unusual objects. I think I needed to find a stamp or cigar in 90% of the scenes. A few of the scenes also had objects that were culturally obscure. Like African symbols. I only knew them bc I watch the Discovery Channel. I don't know how other people would find them without the hint system. It just seemed odd to have those kind of things in a game like this. 

Overall this was a nice, casual game. Not too difficult, not too long (unlike this review), flowed nicely, and had a bit of humor and sarcasim to boot. I'd definately recommend this to HOG fans.

13013752.review:
Do you like Hidden Object Games (short: HOG)?

Then enter this. It is a point and click riddle adventure with Hidden Object Pictures. You have to solve a classical mystery adventure that has a weird background story ...

Quotation: "[i]They walked lithely and sinously erect on pre-mammalian members, their pied and hairless bodies bending with great suppleness. There was a loud hissing of formulae as they went to and fro.[/i] -- Clark Ashton Smith, "The Seven Geases."

This little giveaway will tell you exactly what you are facing and it is a good rendition of a story taking up this old motive. But keep in mind not to play this game if you already suffer from herpetophobia - it might worsen your condition.

It is a casual game, Playing time will be around three to six hours, so there is nothing much to expect from this game after it is solved - replay value is zero. And I have to say that the standard price of 7.99 is quite expensive, though not uncommon. 

If you look for a little time filler with an interesting story and a captivating artwork, don't look further - it is worth your time. But I can only give you a reasonable "Try to get it a bit cheaper". 4.99 would be a better, more fitting price. For 7.99 I can recomend this game only for hardcore Hog'ers - but I won't downvote the game just because of this reason since I really enjoyed playing it.

It might be a reasonable strategy to wait for a while to get this game in a bundle or a voucher (if Artifex Mundi ever does discount-coupons of 33 to 75 %). Or maybe they will feature some of their games in the weekly bargain sale.

13006508.review:
[h1]Short version: 64%[/h1]
If you ever wanted a nice, easy, and stylish noir adventure in the form of a hidden object puzzle that won’t take longer than an average movie, then 9 Clues is your title.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek is all about style. The 1950s noir detective story motif and the incredibly talented scene compositions– which feature slanted shots and lots of wide angle close ups– create a powerful atmosphere. Too bad the same cannot be said about the over the top characters and the horrible voice acting (not counting the protagonist, whose performance saves a few scenes).

Despite the 2013 release date the low resolution graphics and some design flaws make it feel like as if the game was made around 2007, especially in the normal puzzle segments. It’s not like as if the game isn’t trying: it introduces a new HOP type called Detective Mode, a welcomed addition, and also an integral part of the story. But even that can’t help the largest problem, the length. Even the most casual player should be able to finish it well under three hours, making 9 Clues nothing more than a nice one-afternoon entertainment for a low price.

12765147.review:
Spielwertung: 8/10

Mal wieder ein Spiel von Artifex Mundi. Ich verweise auf meine alten Reviews...

Ein paar Anmerkungen:

- Zum 1. Mal ist neben AM noch ein anderes Studio am Werk (nicht zu übersehen im Intro). Man merkt das! Die Qualität ist nicht schlechter oder besser, aber es ist ein anderes Spiel. 
- Wichtigste Änderung: Das Spiel ist wesentlich kürzer als die zuvor von mir gespielten Titel Abyss und NFTD 1&2. Die ersten 3 Titel hatten alle eine Erstspielzeit von ca. 5 Stunden, dieser Titel dagegen "nur" gute 2.5. 
- In diesem Spiel gibt es KEIN Bonuskapitel, was die Spielzeit noch einmal senkt (leider, Minuspunkt)
- In diesem Spiel gibt es KEINE Alternativspiele (Domino, Majongg) zu den WB-Rätseln. Allerdings sind die WB wirklich nicht schwer, auf jeden Fall leichter als sonst, hatte nur 1x Probleme, brauchte aber nie die Hilfe. 
- Das Erfolgssystem ist hier so aufgebaut, dass man nicht 2x durchspielen MUSS, um alle Erfolge einzusammeln (Pluspunkt), allerdings habe ich es dennoch gemacht (machen müssen). Wieso? Es gibt 2 Erfolge, die etwas tricky sind (bzw 3, aber die schwarze Katze war obvious): 1. muss man 9 Fragezeichen im Spiel finden (9 clues), das ist mal mehr, mal weniger schwer. Wer hier auf Nr. Sicher gehen will, sollte vor dem Aufpoppen des Erfolgs NIEMALS den Leuchtturm hochsteigen. Ansonsten heißt es... auf ein Neues. 2. muss man die 3 Dietrichrätsel jeweils in unter 1 Minute schaffen. Das ist nicht schwer, aber wenn man nicht dran denkt, chillig spielt und etwas abgelenkt ist, dann verhaut man es locker (so wie ich bei Nr. 3, die tendenziell auch die schwierigste ist) und schon heißt es: Du kannst noch mal von vorne anfangen. 
- Es gibt auch keine Möglichkeit, in einem "Extra"menü die Rätsel noch mal nachzuspielen. Hatte ja aber eh noch nie Sinn für das Erfolgssystem, von daher wumpe. 

An und für sich hab ich das Gefühl, dass es sich hier eher um ein frühes Werk von AM handelt, bin aber zu faul das nachzuschauen. 

Spielwertung: 

Alles in Allem: DAS IST KEIN SCHLECHTES SPIEL, ich empfehle es definitiv. Aber dennoch gibt es einige Abzüge:
- die kurze Spieldauer (-)
- die Zeichnungen einiger Charaktere (wirkt etwas unheimlich, aber nicht im Sinne von ängstlich, sondern eher von ekelhaft. Vielleicht war das ja bezweckt, aber ich fands etwas... unschön) (-)
- faire Erfolgslaufbahn (+)
- nette, abgefahrene Geschichte, die aber sehr vorhersehbar ist (+)
- nettes Feature mit den Detektivfolgen, gefällt mir gut. 

Alles in allem kann ich mit Sicherheit eine 8 geben, aber zu mehr reicht es nicht. 

Zum Spiel an sich, falls ihr meine alten Reviews zu AM Spielen nicht kennt:

- hübsche Comicgraphik, gute Steuerung, praktisch bugfrei, nette Rätsel, die tendenziell auch ohne jede Hilfe etwas zu leicht sind, was aber besser ist als zu schwer ;), akzeptable Vertonung, nette Story, Schnellreisefunktion.

12679229.review: Just your standard run of the mill hidden object game. This one runs around 2 to 3 hours long depending on how good you are at these sort of games and the difficulty you play at. It's your typical basic point and click fare with some hidden object scenes, detective scenes (basically reverse hidden object scenes. You have to piece together what happened in certain scenes) & a few other easy puzzles thrown together with a story that isn't anything too special. It's just your standard creepy small town with a mysterious figure roaming around story. It is by no means bad and I did enjoy it when all is said and done. There were even some creepy and effective scenes here and there. Just don't expect some masterful writing. This is pretty much as average as you can get. If you get it in a bundle or on sale it's totally worth it but with other Hidden Object games like Nightmares From The Deep on Steam, it's tough to justify this one at full price.

[b] Review [/b] = 9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek is not a bad Hidden Object game. Looks like its going to be the start of the 9 Clues series.

12631882.review:
[i]9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek[/i] to casualowy miks przygodówki typu point'n'click, gry typu hidden object oraz niewymagających łamigłówek. Całość podana w niskobudżetowej ale całkiem przyjemniej oprawie graficznej. Mamy więc nieskomplikowaną ale nawet wciągającą fabułę. Trochę zbierania przedmiotów, które trzeba użyć w odpowiednim miejscu. Kilka niewymagających łamigłówek. A do tego od czasu do czasu musimy odnaleźć w zbieraninie różnistego szmelcu wskazane przez grę przedmioty. Grę przechodzi się relaksacyjnie bez wysiłku - nawet nie ma sensu używać podpowiedzi. Fabuła prowadzi nas jak po sznurku. A gdyby nawet pojawiły się wątpliwości co dalej to na wbudowanej mapce zawsze mamy zaznaczone miejsca, w których trzeba coś zrobić.

Podkreślam, że gra jest przeznaczona dla casualowych graczy. Przygodówkowi wyjadacze nie znajdą tutaj żadnego wyzwania. Mimo to polecam grę. Nabyta w bundlu dostarczy kilka godzin zabawy na luzie za przysłowiowe parę groszy.

Gra posiada polską lokalizację (tylko napisy).

12603277.review:
[h1]Clever Hidden Object-Game[/h1]

It may sound weird to some, but [i]9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek[/i] is actually the first [b]Hidden Object Game[/b] I've ever played. And to make it immediately clear: I liked it a lot! It's stylish, cleverly designed and it has an original story.

[i]9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek[/i] was developed by Tap It Games and published by the well-known Artifex Mundi in July 2013. Some research out of my newly-found interest in this genre, has learned me that Artifex Mundi is perhaps THE prime publisher of this kind of games, and after playing a second one of their games, I can safely confirm that they stand for quality and sheer gaming pleasure.
[i]The Secret of Serpent Creek[/i] could be defined as an adventure-light, or casual adventure game, with a touch of horror added to it. The story is quite original and entertaining and certainly proved interesting enough to keep my interest right through to the final stages. I won't spoil it here, suffice it only to tell that it is also suited for teenagers and maybe even younger children, since there is no offensive context in any way. There are also a whole bunch of helping-tools, perfectly adaptable to everyone's needs with three difficulty levels. Exactly as how it should be done in this kind of games, imo.
The actual gameplay is very much point-and-click orientated, with static screens following upon each other. Most of the times there are objects to be found to advance to the next screen, to solve a puzzle, or to be combined with each other. Thanks to the very intuitive inventory, all this can be done in a smooth manner, and thanks to the map (with fast-travel system incorporated), the amount of backtracking is limited. The shining point of the game are the famous "Hidden Object" scenes, where one has to click several named objects in order to find one story-related object. As easy as this may sound, it proved quite a lot of fun, and even challenge to a non-native English speaker as me. I made a sport out of it not to consult any dictionay, and I've certainly learned a whole bunch a new English word just by playing this game ;-). Apart from the Hidden Object-screens, there are also quite some well-designed puzzles, more of a challenge but still very well designed and easily solved with some thinking.

Since gameplay is limited to pointing, clicking and thinking, graphics and sound are very important to me in this kind of adventure (light). And in these departments [i]9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek[/i] certainly delivers. The scenes are vividly painted, with bright coulours if needed and lots of visual clues. Sound-wise, there's not much to complain about: voice-acting is fine, only the music could have delivered more of a punch.
All in all, this was a very fine first encounter for me wtih this genre, and with the quality-products Artifex Mundi delivers. Don't hesitate if you like this kind of games, and do give it a try when you're curious about them. It's not expensive, and as icing on the cake: it comes with Trading Cards and a set of Steam Achievements that can be made into a perfect game without too much hassle.

Gameplay: 23/30
Graphics: 15/20
Sound: 7/10
Longelivety: 6/10 (decent lenght for this kind of games but not much beside that)
Technical: 9/10
Steam Integration: 10/10
Personal appreciation: 8/10

Overall: 78/100

In this game, a prequel to the Harry Potter series, you encounter a small town run by Lord Voldemort. The two of you go on a grand adventure; at one point, you save his life after he wrecks his car, and at another point, he chases you around a library whilst fully nude (the nudity is only implied, alas). The bad guy is an ancestor of Sirius Black, who runs a sinister hotel setup. 

The puzzles are all very solid, enjoyable to complete without being stupidly easy or stupidly hard. If hidden object games are your bag. you won't steer yourself wrong by picking up this title. (Unlike Voldemort, who should have stuck to his broom instead of a Muggle contraption).

12443282.review:
9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek is a pretty good puzzle/ point & click game. The art is nice, the voice acting is ok, but the music wasn't very interesting at all.

It took me 2 hours and a half to complete the game while also getting 100% achievements. I think the game is extremely short but the price tag is fair anyway and it seems like most people needed at least 5 hours to complete the game so you might get more value out of it.

There's 3 level of difficulty to make the game harder if you prefer having a bigger challenge, but the game isn't very hard either way. I think the story was very good and i'd recommend to purchase this game if you like puzzles or point & click games... Even if you don't know much about the genre, the story is really good so you might enjoy playing this game anyways! Just keep in mind the game is quite short!

12442778.review:
I've never really been a big fan of hidden object games, but I enjoyed this one. You'll probaby figure out the mystery pretty fast, but the story's engaging and the game doesn't get too repetitive (unless you end up playing through a second time to get all the achievements because you missed the third lock by about two seconds).

It's a pretty easy game, and would be great for older kids, especially ones that like their stories a little on the creepy side.  It's a bit short, but I think if it was any longer the story would drag.

Nothing revolutionary, but if you like to chill out and blow through a casual game with a decent story and easy achievements, it's fun and worth picking up especially in a bundle or super cheap sale.

12085630.review:
9 Clues: The secret of Serpent Creek - completed main story line.

First things first, if you are intending to play this game then I strongly suggest putting it on its hardest difficulty. This is a casual point and click and it is one of the easiest I have played so you don't really need the extra help that the game offers. 

This is a puzzle and point and click adventure game. I know that most point and click games have puzzle elements but this one has a stronger focus on them. The main gimick seems to be item searching. You are presented a few times thoughout with a big pile of items and a check list to find them, it's a little bit like one of those games they have in the pub that promises to pay out but in the later levels most likely doesn't even have the items you want to find. The game also has detective mode where you click on a few of the background scenery and your character who puts sherlock holmes in the shade uses her powers of clavioyance to describe exactly what happend! Yes it does stretch the imagination a bit but that's what games are for right? :) On the harder difficulty it supposedly gives you a penalty for miss clicking but I missclicked a load of times to test it out and nothing seemed to change for me which is very strange. Could be a glitch? Or maybe you really do have to miss click like crazy before anything happens.

Although there is detective work I wouldn't really say this is very film noir. It almost felt like a game for children but there was quite a lot of potty mouth at the end of it which was quite surprising for me. It has creepy moments but it is toned down a lot, this won't cause you any fright or jump scare but it is still somewhat disturbing. 

The art work is very nicely done and an awful lot of it is voiced which is nice. Only 3 hours of gameplay though although your milage may vary. If you already own it like I do then it is worth your time and is a nice distraction. I have been suffering like mad with my GID over these last few day and maybe I am being a little more charitable then at a more relaxed time, but it took me out of this world for a few hours and that is worth a lot for me at the moment.

I hope you enjoy it! I did!

12047651.review: It's a relatively simple hidden object puzzle game with a scooby doo type mystery as a follow along back drop. Available in three settings, I would just recommend playing it in expert mode from get go, as it will give you a bit more of a challenge, but still not that much. In effect it's just an animated storyboard with some not that complicated puzzles thrown in for good measure. The game in total might take you approx 3 hrs. It's a game suitable for young children and those that like hidden object games which have become so well liked especially among the female gamers. Regardless of it's simplicity and its quirky out of this world subtext, I actually rather enjoyed it, and it was a refreshing break from all those fps that nowadays are so prevalent. If it ever goes on sale and you have children you want to entertain for a couple of hours...get it.

12042372.review:
一応クリアー済み、蛇神伝説を土台にした推理モノのアドベンチャーゲームです。
まあ推理モノと言っても、アビスなど同様、同パブリッシャー共通のポイント＆クリックシステムを採用しているので、証拠を集めると勝手に推理が始まっちゃいます。
本格的な推理をしたい人には向きませんが、手軽にそれっぽい雰囲気を楽しみたい方におススメ、謎解き（パズル）の一部はスキップもできるので詰まることは皆無です。

あと、このゲームの売りの一つであるアート性は、同パブリッシャーの他のゲームに比べて若干雑目？ただその分、舞台である閉鎖的な田舎町のおどおどしい雰囲気がよく出てるように感じます。
肝心の日本語ローカライズは、若干漢字が間違っていたり、機械翻訳っぽいところがあったりと完璧とは言えませんが、まあ意味は通じますし問題なしだと個人的には思いますね。（一部、グラも日本語仕様に変更するなど、ローカライズへの意気込みは感じられます！）

12040343.review: Not a bad game, good if you just want something fairly simple to sit down to for a couple of hours. 11996914.review: I got this game in a bundle and decided to give it a shot. It is not a bad game - you play as a reporter who investigates the disappearance of her friend. There are multiple objectives at any given point in the game and to achieve those you need to go from one place in the town to the next, looking for clues. The puzzles are not difficult at all which incidentally also makes this a fun game to play. There is a fair variety in the puzzles so you dont exactly get bored. I especially liked the puzzles with jigsaw pictures and picking locks. I finished the game in under 3 hours (not in one sitting) and also completed 17 of the 19 achievements at the same time. Unfortunately, there is not much replayability value in this one. You may want to do but only if you wish to unlock all the achievements. The story is mostly linear though you have to go to and fro to solve some puzzles. There is not much originality to the story, but even so the game is pretty enjoyable. The puzzles are decent and you can easily spend a weekend playing this one. If you find it under $5, you have a good deal.

11781257.review:
Entretenido juego de objetos ocultos, aunque muy corto y de nula rejugabilidad ya que carece incluso de los minijuegos de otros títulos del género. El diseño de los personajes pareciera no ser muy bueno, pero se ajusta perfectamente a la temática ya que recuerda a los carteles e ilustraciones de ciencia ficción de los 50´s o 60´s.
Algún problema menor con la traducción del nombre de los objetos en las escenas de objetos ocultos debido a los múltiples significados o sinónimos que pudiera tener, lo cual es incomprensible hasta cierto punto ya que los diálogos e historia están traducidos impecablemente :
TAPE traducido como PELICULA y uno dándole click al rollo de película que está en la escena sin que algo suceda y siendo penalizado cuando en realidad hace referencia a una cinta adhesiva.
Estos detalles son comúnes en este tipo de juegos y termina uno acostumbrándose, pero en el momento no se pude evitar sentir una pequeña frustración. Además nos encontraremos con algunos puzzles reciclados de otros juegos del mismo desarrollador o editor.
Cumple con su función de hacer pasar un buen rato, pero fuera de eso ho hay mucho que destacar.

11757836.review: Como todos los de artifex mundi es un juego muy entretenido con una historia un poco corta, pasarselo al 100% solo me ha llevado  4 horas, es muy sencillito pero por el precio al que lo compre me parece una buena compra, lo recomiendo si gusta el genero Point-to-click/aventura grafica.

11701456.review: Man this game is amazing. I got a -50% coupon and i said "What the heck let's try it!". So I bought it and started playing it and i saw the graphics and they were pretty neat! 11698059.review: This Hidden Object game is fairly short and the puzzles aren't particularly difficult. Still, the story is so much fun. You're exploring a creepy town and running into large snakes on a regular basis. Most of the townsfolk seem zombie-ish and the rest are highly suspicious. Your friend sent you a distress call from this location so it's up to you to find her and figure out what the heck is going on. Secret of Serpent Creek was so enjoyable that I played it a couple times in a row. And I'm sure I'll play it again at some point. If you find this game on sale and you enjoy hidden object games, puzzles, or SNAKES (I love snakes :p), then I definitely recommend this game.

11691128.review:
부담 없이 즐길 수 있는 퍼즐형 어드벤쳐 게임.
한글화까지 되어 있어 매우 만족스러웠다.
별다른 어려움 없이 클리어 가능하고, 대부분의 도전과제가 자연스럽게 해결되지만
도전과제 100%달성을 위해 몇 가지 신경 쓸 부분들이 있다.

<신경써야하는 도전과제>
1. 고양이 부인: 첫 장면 우측에 있는 고양이를 5번 클릭하면 됩니다. 
고양이가 뻔히 해결책이 보이는 장애물이라고 바로 치워버리면 2회차에 달성하거나 다시 게임을 시작해야 달성할 수 있게 됩니다.
2. 단서 수집가: 게임 전체에 걸쳐 배경에 물음표가 숨어있는데 놓치기 쉽습니다.
http://guides.gamepressure.com/9clues/guide.asp?ID=20749 여기에 정리가 되어있습니다.
3. 아르센 루팡: 자물쇠 따는 퍼즐이 3번 등장 하는데 빨리 해결해야 합니다. 
처음 접하면 은근히 시간이 걸리는 퍼즐이므로 1회차는 스스로 풀어보고 2회차에 빠르게 해결하든지 미리 저 퍼즐들만 공략을 봐둬도 좋습니다.

这么说吧，这款游戏有好玩的地方也有不好玩的地方，主要是，我觉得不管它特不特价，真的就只值5块美刀到顶了。再贵就不对头了。游戏的剧情不错，但是也有不合理的地方，比如说窗外那个影子为什么一直没有杀女主角。比如说有的角色存在是多余。（一开始到大街上在垃圾桶旁边的那位。）
不过总体来讲，这款游戏的画面挺精致的，剧情挺精彩的，至于画风，那就看你自己适应与否啦！

11320895.review:
It's a decent game to play if you like hidden objects and puzzles. Being that it has a pretty specific storyline, it doesn't have much replayability--the only real difference seems to be that some of the hidden object minigames ask for different items (excluding the one item you need for the storyline), but since you do a lot of them twice, it ends up all being the same stuff.
For example:
Playthrough One - Find STORY ITEM 1, star, fish, and shovel. Later you go back and find the STORY ITEM 2, book, wrench, and ball.
Playthrough Two - Find STORY ITEM 1, fish, ball, and wrench. Later you go back and find STORY ITEM 2, shovel, book, and star.

 I finished the game (completing the story + a second playthrough for the achievements I missed) in ~5hrs. It's enjoyable the first time (even if a pretty weird story). And, you may end up replaying it for any achievements you miss. I'd say look into the Trade thread and trade someone for a 50% off coupon if you don't already have it. I think it's worth $4.

11224707.review:
Jeu très intéressant, de beaux décors, énigmes parfaites, plein d'objets cachés, mais ce qui est dommage c'est qu'il n'y est pas de bonus, vraiment ça manque.
Par contre, j'ai fait ce jeu en mode difficile, à présent je le recommence en mode facile, ce qui me permet de refaire les objets cachés qui se retrouvent évidemment pas à la même place.
Jeu en sous titré français, très bonne présentation et explications très claires.

11223599.review:
9 Clues: The secret of Serpent Creed è un'avventura punta e clicca hidden object.
Premettendo che sono un'amante del genere e che sono fan della Artifex Mundi, mi sento di sconsigliare l'acquisto a prezzo pieno di questo titolo.

A differenza degli altri giochi dello stesso editore, questo è molto più corto (l'ho completato in 4 ore), con una storia meno intrigante (e abbastanza scontata) e con enigmi semplici che non rappresentano una grande sfida.
Lo definirei un passo indietro per chi ci aveva abituati a titoli più promettenti come Nightmare from the Deep.

11199684.review: Я очень люблю игры такого плана. И очень люблю игры именно от Artifex Mundi. Но эта игра не стоит тех денег, которые за нее хотят. Сюжет относительно простой, но это и не важно. В таких играх важны головоломки, сцены поиска предметов и неожиданные повороты. В этой игре все это есть, но очень и очень мало. Всю игру удалось пройти за 1 час 38 минут. Это уже ни в какие ворота. Тот же Nightmares from the Deep от этой же компании проходится минимум за 4 часа. И стоит столько же, сколько и эта игра. В итоге 9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek любителям казуалок можно рекомендовать, но только, когда будет -75% скидка. Ибо полтора часа геймплея не стоят заявленной цены.
